The menu is very limited (I don't eat red meat, shellfish or salads) so there was only a few items I could order. I thought it was just me (due to my limited diet) but the rest of my party felt the same way. The menu itself is only one page. I ended up ordering the Brick Oven Chicken. It was moist and good as was the Mac n Cheese. Some friends ordered the Shrimp and Linguini and Salmon and said they were good. We loved the honey salted butter that was served with the bread. We had two servers (one for the bread and beverages) and our main server. Our main server was not that great but our other server was amazing. We ended up ordering a Brookie for desert. The cookie and brownie were just ok but the salted caramel chunk ice cream was amazing. We might come back again but only for special occasions as it's a little too pricey for us.

This place is definitely for hipsters, which me and my boyfriend are not. It is well decorated and feels really "cool" but the food wasn't anything to rave about. One of those places that people go to just to say they've been there, I guess. I went for dinner, and the dinner menu is actually smaller than their lunch menu? I thought that was weird. All the things that I saw on yelp reviews and I actually wanted to try were not for sale at the time I went. I settled and had curry, it was alright. So they get an okay review, because everything there was okay. Nothing bad, just nothing special.

Oh I lied, there was one thing that was pretty great. We paid four bucks for their self-filtered water and it was actually really amazing. LOL. I know that sounds like I totally got ripped off but the water was literally tasteless it felt so weird to drink. Quite the experience. I wouldn't go back for water, but I am glad I tried it once!

First time here. Nice atmosphere and very comfortable. My food was amazing - had the eggs Benedict! My fianc√© ordered the steak
And eggs medium but steak came out medium rare. These guys rectified the situation with the under cooked meat amazingly. Gave us a free mimosa and took the meal off the bill. Val was a great server, friendly fast and attentive. Thank you also Daniel for the help. We will all be coming back soon, highly recommend!

We came for brunch and it was very busy. I got strawberry pancakes and they were so yummy! 
Our server tony was so helpful answering questions about the menu, and making sure we had a good experience. I will request to sit in her section every time I come in!

Wonderful, relaxing vibe. Excellent, attentive service without being overbearing. Delightful food. Came here with a couple others for a business dinner. We shared the tuna tartare, charcuterie plate, and a couple other dishes. Everything was beautifully prepared and tasty. Good place for a date or business meal.

Went here for dinner based on the reviews and overall I found that the food was very good, but it is really overpriced.  I noticed numerous other reviews say the same about the prices.  One lady I saw said she did NOT think it was overpriced, and quoted that she paid $35 for 1 entr√©e and 1 appetizer at lunch.  You don't think $35 for a lunch with appetizer is overpriced?  Man, I wish I could live in that world.

The stuff we had was typical "high end" fare...exotic sounding ingredients in small, well presented portions.  For 2 people for dinner, we had 2 appetizers, 2 salads, 1 entr√©e, and 1 dessert...no wine/drinks of any sort and the bill was $100 flat including tax without tip.  The prices need to come down about 20% in my opinion, although I could live with 15%.  As it stands, we really enjoyed the food but it isn't the kind of place we will justify going back to any time soon.  I like great food and I have no issues spending big money on great food, but it is just too overpriced, even for an overpriced haute cuisine type place.

The grilled octopus appetizer was very good.  A nice char with a good blend of flavors from the romescu, potato and avocado, but at $16, it was about $4 too much.

The prawn appetizer was tasty, although they were overcooked.  Also, 4 large prawns in a flavored broth is a bit much at $15.  

The free range chicken breast entr√©e was very good as well.  It came with a little portion of their tasty mac and cheese, with chile and white cheese (cheddar I believe).  Cripsy on the outside and pretty juicy inside.  Very good, but again, at $23 for 1 large breast and some mac and cheese, it is about $4 too much.

My wife had a nice little peach salad, which was good, especially since peaches are in season.  It consisted of 1 peach, halved, then topped with some kind of cheese and nuts and some other items.  Not exactly a massive serving, and if I remember correctly it was $14 or $16.  1 peach...cut. in. half.  Come on.

The one thing that I felt was pretty fairly priced was the dessert.  I had a peach pie, which came with a nice scoop of ice cream, and it was a pretty decent sized serving, and for $9, it was pretty on point I felt.

Also, they have a delicious little bread basket which is on the house and they even refilled it, so obviously I appreciate that there are other house costs like the free bread that have to be covered, but at these prices you better eat a few baskets.  Not hard to do mind you, especially with the tasty little mix of butter, salt, honey and olive oil they provide.

Overall, the food was great and we had no issues with the service as some others have described.  However, at $100 pre tip with only house water to drink and $118 with tip for 2 people and only ONE entr√©e and 1 dessert, it was just WAY too much.  $85 pre tip would be acceptable, $75-80 would be better.  Would I return?  Sure...but not anytime soon and probably only on rare occasions.  For that kind of money, they are other places I enjoy and other places I want to try, so I just can't justify working into any kind of regular rotation.

Loved this place!  We were there for dinner last night and it was a fantastic experience.  We started off with an awesome server (thanks Adrian!) who was not only well versed in the details of the menu but also extremely thoughtful and fun to interact with.  Followed by craft cocktails, which were both great, you can't go wrong with half off at happy hour either.  The food was just as good, we shared both happy hour plates and dinner, all which were excellent.  Wrapping up the night was the best experience I've had with restaurant management since I've been in Vegas, Katie Strzelec worked out a complication we had using a gift card and could not have been more gracious or easy to work with.  All around great experience, we'll be back.

We were looking for a nice place to have lunch and a few drinks. Wanted somewhere with an outdoor patio.. decided to try Honey Salt. A bit of construction going on in parking lot and neighboring shops, but we didn't mind. Their our door seating on this sunny,  glorious Las Vegas afternoon was empty and we were worried they weren't seating outside because of construction. However, the very friendly hostess assured us we could sit
 outside and put the umbrella up for us.

Our waitress, Fatima, came out soon after and immediately got us some water. The service, food, and atmosphere was excellent! 

At the end of our dining experience, we asked a few questions about the history behind the place and the food, and while our server wasn't quite sure, she let us know she would find out. We were also asking why menu wasn't posted online, as the 3rd party site that shows a menu was outdated. All three of us had no problem choosing meals on the current menu, but still think a current available menu online should be offered...

We were soon greeted by one of the managers Katie, who gave us a bit more info and also left us with a few drink coupons for our next visit. We have no complaints about our experience at Honey Salt, just a suggestion o  posting current menu on your website... we brought a very picky eater and tried to do our research beforehand and what we thought she would like wasn't available. It turned out all great because she LOVED your tomato soup and grilled cheese. Thanks to all the staff for a lovely lunch at Honey Salt!

Enjoying my leftovers as I write this! 5*

Had our early valentines dinner and it ws a great experience. It was our first time their and we were taken care of right away. We ordered the new England Fry for appetizer and it came out bigger than we expected and it has amazing flavor. 


The two people helping our table were very nice and always checked on us and made sure our water was filled. The red snapped and the ahi salad were amazing. The flavors were so good! Props to the chef! 

Overall we had an amazing experience. Definitely try this place out! It is a bit pricey but its a good place date :)

I came in with a friend for Sunday brunch at 11:00 and we were promptly seated by a hostess. It was a little confusing at first, because the hostess showed us to our table and then another man brought our drinks and finally our server came over to help us. Good service, just more people than I am used to. 

Feeling underwhelmed by the choices and their prices, I had a small latte and the monkey bread ($9). My friend Sam had the frittata ($13 if I remember correctly) and a cup of regular coffee. The monkey bread was basically a jazzed-up Cinnabon with a boozy bourbon sauce...tasty but cloyingly sweet. The latte was just okay, with the espresso notes mostly getting lost in the milk. 

The vibe is strange in here because at first glance it appears to be a cute cafe, but there are connecting booths by the wall that make it feel more like a cafeteria. We sat an elbow's distance away from a group of people having a business meeting which was slightly uncomfortable. 

Maybe I'll have to come back to check out their dinner scene, but as far as brunch goes Honey Salt has pretty standard fare for an upscale price.

Never disappoints!  I'm a creature of habit so i usually get the same thing, grain power add chicken. I dream about this salad. I've also had the halibut which is amazing (born and raised in Alaska so I know good halibut) turkey meatballs are a must starter as well as are their flatbread pizzas. The ice cream (salted Carmel) is like nothing I've had before. So good. Baked apple pie and the bread pudding are also to die for. Absolutely a Summerlin beauty with regards to restaurants.

Staff: great fun
Drinks: delicious on many levels
Scallops: melt in your mouth
Ambience: hip and trendy yet comfortable 
Avocado toast: good but not my favorite 
Brookie dessert: great ice cream

Came for brunch for my daughters bday. Bottomless mimosas are her favorite. So no complaining there. I will say the food was just ok. My breakfast pizza was tasty but the crust was mushy. The breakfast sandwich was very good and the breakfast nachos were also tasty.  The chicken fingers on the kids menu were too well done and the fries were not done enough.   The waitress was working herself to death  appeared understaffed. And I felt rushed as they were trying to clear my plate while I still had my fork in my hand.  I have been here before and was excited to go again but I was disappointed

Food is reliably great. Service is also strong. Hostess nice and quick to seat us. Asst server (?) Named Jade got our drinks and refilled our water 3 times before our order was taken. And it wasn't a long wait to order. Nick (goatee) was helpful and complimentary. Really great service, all around 

Farmer toast is a fun alternative to regular bread. Wife lives the grilled octopus. Salmon is bomb. Get the squash. And any way they make ahi tuna...get it now!

Not returning! Only 1 star good food food flavors, the rest forgettable! Way over priced for the portions 4-5oz of Salmon for $25, left hungry & a ounce of Bourbon for $11? We tried to get the vibe, almost $300 for 4 of us. Even though they had empty tables we where rushed and at 1 point did not get to finish a appetizer? It was cleared prior to being finished? Good Luck

We were just around the corner and yelp'd nearby restaurants and Honey Salt popped up!  I had actually heard about this place from a friend a few months ago, so we had to try it.  I was especially interested in trying the fried chicken sandwich, but silly me- it's not on the dinner menu!

Just a few notes:
-We were seated right away.  The first thing we noticed was that the restaurant's name is LITERALLY on everything, haha.  
-It's a little dim in the restaurant, in fact the older groups surrounding our table were actually using the flashlight apps on their phones to read the menu.  
-My boyfriend and I were wearing jeans and a t-shirt, which made us stick out like sore thumbs!  
-The chef was hanging out in the front the whole time and didn't greet any customers or walk up to any tables, including the special event that was going on.  This may seem nitpicky, but it seemed weird that he was just kinda doing nothing the whole time!
-Meal sizes are small.  Not a complaint, just an observation in case you're reading this and planning a dinner on a budget!
-There is a large seafood selection!

First, based on a recommendation from our server (very friendly), we ordered the grilled octopus ($16).  It was tender and had a nice char; the sauce underneath and the other components all fit pretty well together.  Unfortunately, the bus boy took our plate without asking if we were finished!

We shared the special ($30 for two 5oz. Lamb porter house steaks, cooked medium rare).  It was perfectly cooked and I swear I tasted some type of Indian/Mediterranean flavors in the jus.  Not a lot to savor, but we're supposed to be thinking quality over quantity!

Finally, we ordered two desserts- the brookie and bread pudding.  I love a good bread pudding that is moist and drenched in sauce.  This was not a great bread pudding and I was pretty disappointed!  It's a HUGE serving comparable to a rubix cube and SUPER dry.  There was not enough sauce and it wasn't gooey or sickeningly sweet like bread pudding is supposed to be!  The "brookie" is a chocolate chip cookie housed in a brownie with salted caramel icecream on top.  All components were good, but I'm not so sure either dessert was worth the $9.   ***FYI, 2 desserts is too much!*** 

Overall our dinner totalled $68 (not including tip).

I've never even heard of this place until my sister wanted our family to go here for brunch. I got there after my family have already ordered. My food came out shortly after them which was nice.  fairly small brunch menu, but everything was delish! I had the tuna. It was so light and fresh. I love the uniform for the waiters. Service was good even though it was pretty busy.

I've been here about four or five times. The food is always excellent! The service is getting better. 

Last time we went for lunch. We were sat and kind of forgot about. The server came by once, and we noticed him bringing out things for all the tables around us, like bread, drinks, etc. We kind of started looking around for a few minutes when a man in a suit and tie came right over and asked us if we wanted to order, gave us bread, came back with drinks. I'm pretty sure he might have been the GM, and he was great. Not really sure what happened to our server, but he stepped in and took charge. 

I definitely believe they are trying. The food is great....and if you can have a little patience the service is looking up! 

I'll be back.

Second time here. First time, fabulous. This time service was horrible. And this was to celebrate my husband's birthday, so I wanted to take him to a place I had been before and thought would be great.  So disappointed.  First, we received stale, hard dinner rolls. Last time they were fresh, crusty on the outside and light as air inside, but this time not so. The butter to go with the dinner rolls last time was filled to the top, you could see the honey and black salt, but this time it was half filled and hardly any salt and no visible honey. We ordered the fish fry; delicious. Next, we ordered our main dishes with a side of creamed corn. We got the main dishes, but not the side of corn. Our waitress never came over after the main dishes were served until 15-20 minutes later, our main dishes almost gone, to see if everything was ok, at which point we told her we never got the corn. Another 10 minutes later the corn arrived. I was already done with my meal when it arrived. Then we waited another 10-15 minutes after the table was cleared before our waitress came over to see if we wanted desert, and because we had a movie planned, we could not take a chance with her poor service to order dessert and get our bill, so we declined dessert, got our bill, paid, and as we were walking out a tall gentleman, who assumed was the manager or owner asked my husband how everything was, and my husband said, "You don't want to know." And apparently he didn't because he let us walk right out without asking us what the issue was.  Sorry to say this experience left a bad taste in my mouth and we will probably not be returning. And a closing note--this place was empty when we arrived at 6:30 p.m.  I would overlook poor service if the place was crowded and the waitress had a lot to tend to, but tonight that was the opposite.

If you want a boujie brunch spot, this is the place to go! It's super cute inside that it's good for Instagram pictures. But the food selection is not my favorite. They don't have that many options other than salads. There's so many other Brunch spots that's cute that has way more options.

I had higher expectations of this place.

I came here with my girlfriend on a Saturday night. Place was dead...(not a good sign)

Location is pretty bad - stuck in between a pottery barn and a boutique shop - outside doesn't look like much.

Inside - very chic and cute. They plate your food out in the open for all the tables to see which I thought was unique.

Staff was very friendly and management stopped by to check on us. Sadly, our waiter could care less about us. Never checked on us even though our table was right next to the stand where they plug in your orders. He gave off the worst vibe...killed our mood. We had to ask for the dessert menu and water from other waiters and staff!

The Food:
The food was actually pretty good. Small portions and high price for the amount of food - don't be fooled by the pictures. But the quality and flavor was really good. I must say, the presentation on all of these dishes were fantastic!

Tuna Tartar - So Good! Flavor was amazing and fresh!

Beet Salad - Great flavor and presentation

Steak Salad - Steak and great flavor...just not very much of it

Salmon (what they recommended) - could have been better - Salmon was overcooked - pass

Scallops - Slightly overcooked but the sauce was amazing! The flavor of this dish was excellent 

Blueberry Bread Pudding- needed to be served piping hot - not luke warm - pass

Apple Pie - needed crumble of some sort or nuts - it was ok

Brookie - Awesome! Especially with the salted caramel ice cream.

Order a bottle of Cabernet - didn't expect much but it wasn't good at all. (On the menu it was marked as $30 for the bottle, on my bill they hit me for $50...so beware!)


Overall experience was a 3 - I left slightly disappointed - I was hoping for much more.
Upscale yet cozy. Perfect for Summerlinites.

I was really looking forward to the dining experience here. I had a special evening planned with my folks, who I was visiting. I came from Austin and thought, farm to table, this has to be good! I don't think there was anything glaringly bad about the experience, but I left feeling very uninspired and that is not how I like to feel when looking at dishes that are in the 20-30 range for entrees. I truly feel like the menu needs an overhaul and don't feel the items really stood out in any creative way. My parents live around the corner from this restaurant, but unfortunately, the experience was not very memorable, so I can't imagine going out of our way to go back again.

Really delicious food. Will definitely come again! The location was a little hard to find (thank goodness for Google maps), but once we got in and had our meal, we were very pleased. Keep up the good food!

So in LV on business & saw the exceptionally high number of favorable reviews so stopped in for dinner. Adrian my waiter (& the rest of staff & Mgr) could not be more friendly. The farm to table menu was amazing. Check out the beet salad I ordered it was awesome. Adrian found out I was visiting the area and was kind enough to give me a taste of their wonderful desserts to entice me to come back for more food this week since I will be here for several days.

Delicious. Had the duck salad and it's pretty close to being as good as Hakasan's duck salad. I'll definitely go back and try the rest of the menu. I like that it's farm to table and fresh with an ever changing menu.

This place is ok.  Food is decent.  Happy hour burger or chicken should come with 2, not just 1 of the sliders.  Not many windows in this place but they do keep it pretty bright.  Twice I went and they were out of drink ingredients to make one of the featured drinks on the menu.  Most annoying thing is both times I went they only had one bartender at 5pm on a Friday.   The bartender had to make the drinks for the bar and restaurant so everything was very slow and took a long time.  Very un-Summerlin of them.

Overall, it's a good restaurant, it's just very limiting for my taste
I've been to Honey Salt  a few times since they've opened. And when I say limiting, I try to stay away from bread, pasta, legumes.
Both times for lunch I had the steakhouse salad and absolutely loved it. For dinner, I've had the Filet Mignon and their Fried Chicken. With the Filet, I've ordered it once and then my next trip my husband ordered it. Both times it wasn't cooked to order, it seems cooking steaks might not be the cooks strong suit. We both eat our steak medium: mine came our barely cooked at all and my husbands was medium well. But the filets were good and grass-fed. 
The fried chicken was a special that night, and it was awesome! The only thing I didn't care for on that plate was the corn salsa - but I'm not a huge salsa fan. And the chicken is free-range. 
The best part about this place is the desert - the brookie is to die for! Don't order it alone though or you'll feel guilty for weeks. The brown bag pie is great, along with the salted caramel ice cream. mmmmm

First of all, I have been at Honey Salt several times.  And each time In all fairness, they are very slow!  There was only 3 other couples o. The whole place today!  I tried the spicy sausage and green olive pizza. I thought that it was only OK. I can personally make a better pizza at home than this.  The sausage was not spicy at all, it was very bland.  I know that the better choice at Honey Salt is the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich.  I have had the chicken sandwich on another occasion, and it it good.

Our first visit to the restaurant and we were beyond thrilled! 
-LOVE LOVE LOVE that we had a server trained in fine dining and gave an exceptionally level of service to our table for the duration of our dinner.
-Excellent food that while 'American' is non traditional and reimagined for tastes that appreciate culinary technique and new flavors
-Atmosphere was fantastic! So incredible what a developed vision of interior design can do for the dining experience. More restaurant owners should take note and pay a professional! 

HoneySalt gets it right on every level! We will return!
Really well put together restaurant. Playful food program with good value, great technique. Serious service standards for the price points.

I had to complete my quest for one of the top ten burgers of Las Vegas list so I ordered the backyard burger. My burger was cooked perfectly but the tomato jam combination didn't work for me. It wasn't terrible but it didn't knock my socks off either. The meat was tasty and with different toppings, I would have probably enjoyed the burger a lot more.  I didn't like the fries and I barely finished half my fries. 

I had a bite of my friend's dishes and it was just underwhelming to me. I was expecting a lot more after hearing all the rave reviews. However, I like the ambiance of the place and we did see a celebrity there so that was neat. I will go a second time to try the other dishes.

How disappointing!!
The restaurant was not busy but took 20 minutes to get acknowledged at the table. We sat outside and inside was empty. Our server said it's so busy as everyone came at once. She said 'hey I'm doing good though'. 
They were out of three cocktails on the list. When we found one they had it was warm. 
The manager never came outside. He was leaning on the bar drinking diet Red Bull's. The bartender was yawning and watching tv. 
Spare Rib came out ice cold. Table next to us got their entrees before their salads and were told they could keep them warm if they liked. 
The English style chicken curry was good and Philippine busses was excellent. 
Wine list was dull and red wine was warm. 
We were very disappointed. This place is very poorly managed when one server is outside alone with seven tables and no management present to help her

This is our 3rd time dining at Honey Salt. The first time we came here was about 3 years ago and had a wonderful meal. The 2nd time was similar to our most recent disaster and we were hoping at the time that it was just an off night but it's obvious that it wasn't. My family came in from out of town and my wife and I took them here on the night of Sunday, April 23rd. We had a reservation and got seated immediately as the restaurant was mostly empty. The waitress took our drink orders - My Dad ordered a Stella Artois and we also ordered pitchers of Sangria. It took 15 minutes for the waitress to come back with waters and to also say that they're out of Stella Artois. No exaggeration - My Dad tried to order 4 more beers only for the waitress to come back and say that they don't have them anymore and need to update their menu. He finally says to just bring him any type of light beer similar to a Stella Artois only to be brought a beer that was as hoppy as a Sierra Nevada. The waitress finally brings the pitchers of Sangria after this debacle and it's completely watered down and gross. Manager comes over and apologizes and tells us that the Sangria is pre-made earlier in the day and must have gone bad.. he grabbed a straw, tasted it, and agreed. 

So we finally get some drinks and at this point we have been seated for 45 minutes and have finished the basket of bread. We ask for more bread and are told that they are all out of bread for the night... sigh. We ordered a couple appetizers/salads including the crab meat lettuce wraps which were delicious and the kale caesar salad which was also very good. Our dinner comes out and at this point we are seated for close to 2 hours. My Dad couldn't catch a break as the waitress forgot to ring in his flat bread so again the manager comes over and apologizes and says it will be made on the fly and out in a few minutes. 15 minutes go by and his pizza arrives under cooked and flavorless while all of us have pretty much completed our entrees. We didn't say anything about the flat bread and just chalked it up as a loss as my Mom ended up sharing her scallops with him. 

It's really unfortunate that they don't have their stuff together at all as the food and ambiance for the most part is great. As much as I want to love this place, my wife and I left there embarrassed that we brought our family there and unfortunately won't be returning.

Honey Salt earns a solid 4 stars in my book.  What they do, they do well.  Plenty of enjoyable options to eat, an incredibly welcoming atmosphere, and an attentive wait staff are all wonderful reasons to come by Honey Salt. 

Some of my highlights from Honey Salt: 
1. The Scallops!...actually the scallops are good, but the cauliflower puree and truffle sauce that they come on are simply delightful and elevate the dish a great deal!

2. The Midnight Rambler--Bourbon/Honey/Orange/Bitters/Ginger!..It is a Bourbon-forward, balanced drink...I think it is anyway...see my note below on consistency   

3. The Anaheim Pepper Mac-n-Cheese!  Why doesn't everyone use Anaheim Peppers with pasta and cheese?  They play so well together!

4. The Steak Tartar!  Capers and Pickled Papaya?...um, yes please!

5. The wall of mirrors won't ever get old for me.  Love the feel of that side of the room especially...and the general inviting feel of the space as a whole.

The bottom line for me on 4 stars and not 5?...
1. I enjoy unique/creative approaches and most of what I've tried at Honey Salt is fairly straight forward, with a subtle change here or there...I guess I was just hoping for a little more from this Farm-to-table style spot.

2. Consistency...I'm hoping they iron this out.  If they don't I would drop it a star or two instantly.  I enjoyed The Midnight Rambler a great deal on my 1st visit.  On my 2nd time to Honey Salt I received an unbalanced shot of bourbon with some hints of the other ingredients.  The lesson learned here?...See Leann (sp?) at the bar for a sure bet.  Same thing happened with the Free Range Brick Oven Chicken...wonderfully moist the 1st time--dry and tough the second...I would hate to have someone else order this thinking that I liked it if was not executed perfectly!

3.  There are a lot of tables in Honey Salt.  They also have a great wait staff that is on the ball and moving quickly to keep you satisfied...the overall outcome of this is like watching an ant farm while you eat.  It can be a little over stimulating.  Additionally, the tables aren't jam-packed...but they are closer than I want for a nice evening out.

4.  The bar is way too small for the space.  This results in a wait that could have been easily avoided.

Recently celebrated a friend's birthday here. The manager and bartender were fantastic. We all shared entrees and everyone was attentive to our table and experience. The food and desserts were delicious. Thank you for a great evening.
This was my first time here and it was amazing! The fried chicken was by far the best I've had in Vegas...too bad they only serve it on Sunday's. Save room for dessert and order the Brookie
The food was ok the price was ok the service was ok.  Little boring.  Don't go out of your way for it.

Dined solo at Honey Salt this month and had a great meal.  I sat at the bar and was immediately greeted with a smile, menus, water and the specials.  Bar tender was very attentive along with the other staff. While eating at the bar, I did not feel that they were not pushy or overbearing- they kept their space but did their jobs as well.  I can definitely see why some people have trouble with their service.  There was not a designated hostess in sight (I wonder if they all serve and host.)

The restaurant itself wasa little loud and dimly lit, but the space is open which lends to that.  Both the drink and food menus have something to offer just about anyone.  I ordered the steak salad and was not disappointed. Cooked to order which for me is rare (no pun intended)

For dessert, I had a lava brownie that was oh so good... I would go back just for that. 

Tip: Wine Wednesday- any bottle of your choice for 1/2 the price. Can't/Don't want to finish? they'll pack it up for you along with receipt.

Been hearing great things about this restaurant for the last couple years. So I took the opportunity to go to Honey Salt on an impromptu day off this week with a friend. About as perfect a dining experience as I've ever had. The ambience is in inviting and open. The music was good the whole playlist I was there. The waiter and assistant were both wonderful. Helping guide us through this dining experience. We were recommended the scallops and the scampi. The Poke appetizer was light and delicious. The scallops (which usually are not my favorite) were divine in the truffle oil and the scampi were huge. The Mac and cheese was the right blend of cheesy and creamy with just a hint of spicy. Had to get the brookie as well for desert topped with salted caramel ice cream. Everything was good to the last bite. Best dining experience I've had all year and this restaurant and food choices get my highest recommendations!

cool trendy restaurant in summerlin.  great place for brunch with yummy options and ambiance.
monkey bread was prefect for sharing.  warm, sweet, and gooey.  texture of the bread seemed as if it was warmed up in the microwave....?
steak and eggs sliders tasted like sausage seasonings with a good slab of beef and good slab of eggs.  comes in 2 sliders with a side of potato wedges.  some wedges could use a bit more time in the oven/fryer.  nice caramelized onions.
persimmon toast was simple but fresh.  2 toasted slices of bread topped with ricotta/honey, grilled persimmons and arugula.  comes with a shot of green juice.  healthy!
bfast pizza was a good size.  flatbread topped with bacons, cheese, and scrambled eggs.....it was odd so we asked for sunny side up eggs which looked gorgeous.  

service was ok, ambiance was good, interior design was nice.  use the salt hand cleanser in the bathroom...smooth hands!

I visited here yesterday for brunch with the family. We were a larger group of six and the restaurant was obviously busy. We were seated without a wait thanks to our reservation that we had booked a few days before. We were immediately greeted upon arriving at our table by Adrian. He asked if we would like any drinks to start and would give us a few minutes to look over the menu. He returned back with waters and gave us recommendations on his favorites to share before our main course. 

We took his advice on the appetizers and got an order of the monkey bread to share. They were to die for and the plate was cleaned within minutes! With our server being 1/1 I decided to take his advice and order the breakfast nachos with steak for my main meal. Again, Adrian did not disappoint with his taste selection. The rest of my party was also pleased with their food orders and we all left with a great first experience at the Honey Salt. 

Our server made the experience an easy first by guiding us through the menu and making selections that were exactly what we were looking for. His welcoming sense of humor and attention to detail, such as assuring our glasses were always full or making sure to stop by and check how we were, made this experience unique from other restaurants. I am excited to visit again and can only hope to have Adrian the second time around!

Such a great location for some brunch. My girls and I ordered different things so we can all try a little bit of everything. Everyone seemed to enjoy their peach Bellini, blood orange mimosa, Bloody Mary, and I loved my white sangria. Very refreshing. 

We ordered a salad, margarita pizza, crab lettuce wraps, frittata with bacon, eggs Benedict, grilled cheese, ricotta pancakes, and monkey bread. First and foremost, I have to rave about the monkey bread because it was the first item we shared. Omgggahhhhhhh *eyes rolling back*, it was just amazing. Theeee best monkey bread EVER! I don't think I'll ever make them at home again haha. It's perfection. That alone is enough to bring me back.

Everything else was good too. I was expecting more from the Ricotta pancakes the strawberry preserves was pretty over powering that the pancakes did not stand out. I especially enjoyed the frittata with bacon. 

Service was overall great. Friendly staff. Everyone greets you upon entry and exit. My friends kept raving about the hand scrub in the bathrooms too.
Awesome food, service, and ambiance. Girlfriend loves the decor. We visited on a Wednesday for bottomless mimosas (Drunk as I leave this review.) - Will most likely be back.

My family and I just ate here for Father's Day.  We made reservations and once we arrived to be seated there was already complications with the transitioning from the brunch menu into the dinner menu.  When we had initially made the reservations, the website stated that the dinner menu would start at 2:30; the whole reason why we made reservations at 3pm. That was mistake number one and the had to wait another 30 minutes at a table in order to order from the dinner menu.  We waited 40 minutes until our food arrived.  The steak I ordered was suppose to be a filet mignon, well done and was not cooked to my preference, so I had to send it back.  It took another 10 minutes and when it came back the steak was a strip steak not a filet and just bland; no seasoning whatsoever.  I would not recommend this restaurant, especially for the pricing of the food and the service was horrible.  The managers did nothing and did not apologize for the wait or cooking oversight. The only highlight of great service was from the first table greeter who took our drink orders and kept up the refills too.  We did make sure to give him a separate tip, since he knows what customer service is all about!

Super unprofessional.. We drove all the way from Henderson only to find out they were closing 45 min early.. We walked in at 9:15 They said they usually close at 10pm but since they were slow they decided to close the kitchen 45 min early..

So, I rate this restaurant with 4 stars for the FOOD, location, and general appeal. Unfortunately, not the service. (This is my third time dining here and service has never stood out to me). The food and wine list are both very unique and creative. I give a lot of credit to the designer of the venue; nailed the small details (salt scrub in the bathroom to custom napkins). Well done. 

I do have to give some credit to Rodrigo (busser).  He was attentive and friendly, even more than our server.

My boyfriend and I were in town for CES for longer than anyone should ever spend in Las Vegas without living there. I was so sick of the overcrowded and overpriced scene on the strip and found Honey Salt after a short search. It was only a 25 minute and $25 dollar UBER ride from the strip and worth the short trek to eat in such a fun and cozy spot. Everything was delicious and fresh. Seems like a hip spot with Vegas locals but it's well worth the short trip and in a newly developed part of town. Try it!

The setting and decor is nice. Their outdoor area is also a great amenity. The staff was friendly and helpful. There's not a great selection on the menu especially for someone who doesn't eat seafood. The food was decent. Maybe even better than decent. But it's a little pricey.

I have visited honey salt over the past few years and it has been awhile since my last visit. This time around I can honestly say it has been less impressive than my past experiences. This last experience is disappointing because I have always spoke highly of the restaurant based off of the food and service. The food was mediocre compared to the pricing. Normally the pricing doesn't faze me if the food meets the price.  However, if I have to return an items due to under and over cooked temperatures it's disappointing. Also the menu that is supposed to be based off farm to table and seasonal ingredients hasn't dieviated from the last time I was here. The menu lacks imagination from the previous chefs before hand. Staples items aren't failures but lack of execution and change are. 
The service was ok. Not horrible but not the best as expected based off the business brand nor previous experiences... I often found myself asking the busser for service because he was the only around.
Amazing food and great service! Love the beautiful ambiance too! The Brookie and bread pudding are a must! Love that they use local produce too.

Has potential to be a great restaurant, however the service is absolutely terrible.
The server took his time to greet us, didn't bother to check on us once the food arrived & I had to hunt him down to get the check.
The food was ok

When it initially opened, Honey Salt was amazing. The last two times I've gone (in the past 3 months) my experience has been mediocre all around. The food wasn't as good and the service was definitely not the same. Hopefully they can make some changes real soon. I want to be a 5 star rating!

This a great place,  frequented by Vegas locals.  The market salad is great,  so is the salmon and the grilled cheese. Their desserts are awesome too. They can get busy so a reservation is a good idea. They have a great lunch deal for twenty bucks. Also they'd a nice salt scrub in the bathroom.

This was my first experience at Honey Salt. We had a very large party (about 20 girls) and the waitress had great patience and made sure everyone always had what they needed. I had the breakfast sandwich which was so yummy! And the girls around me had breakfast nachos which they loved! Now one of us did have a birthday and they brought each of us a small brownie filled with warm liquid chocolate which tastes incredible!! I would seriously go back just to eat those brownies!! So good! 10/10 would recommend

We've been to this restaurant several times in the past for numerous occasions (Valentine's Day, date nights, etc.) and finally getting around to writing a review after our last visit two days ago.  We decided last minute to go in for their happy hour and, if we were in the mood, stretch it out into a full blown dinner.  Luckily, its Restaurant Week so there was no hesitation in deciding to stay for dinner!

One of the things I like about Honey Salt is they allow their customers to take part in the happy hour menu from the main dining room...a novel idea that I think more restaurants should allow for.  We ordered the buffalo cauliflower and the lump crab lettuce cups.  The latter was so good we ordered another!  Their cocktails were outstanding, as usual, and half-priced for HH.

They had a 3-course prix fixe menu specially for Restaurant Week and it was a knockout and fairly priced at $40.17 per person.  My wife chose the New England Fry for app, Steak Frites for main, and the ridiculously tasty fudge brownie/chocolate chip cookie/salted caramel ice cream dessert.  I had the Caesar salad, grilled Scottish salmon for main, and the vanilla panna cotta.  Everything was perfectly executed and delicious.  Service was spot-on as well - personable, efficient and attentive.

Honey Salt is a great place to have in our neighborhood and I'm glad they're here.  Consistency with restaurants isn't always easy to come by but Honey Salt manages to pull it off every time.  We'll definitely keep going back!

Oh Honey Salt I understand why you must be on the West Side but I wish you weren't so far so I could be a regular. I loved this place. The ambiance and high ceilings along with an instant greeting made me feel very welcomed. I loved the attire of the staff. You knew who was doing what depending on their matching outfits. I met a fellow foodie Kim, who I know from being a foodie. So this was a perfect place for a lunch date! We had both already looked up the menu and knew we wanted to try the turkey meatballs, so we decided on the meatball pizza as an app. Came with caramelized onions and a very fresh ricotta cheese. However the tomato sauce was too bland for my personal preference. I went with the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich and Kim had the grilled cheese (that has a way fancier name than that). The chicken was fried to perfection and so juicy. The sweet mustard style sauce on it was so good I'd buy a bottle! It was also served with a chopped salad that was quite unique. It had radishes, edamame, and chunks of cheese. Way better than fries! I had a bite of Kim's grilled cheese and it was pretty bomb too, but I liked mine more. 
I also had a Bloody Mary as a cocktail, OMG why doesn't everyone make this drink with jalape√±o vodka??! So smart! 
A little overpriced, but I guess that's Summerlin for you. The service was very good, til the end it got a little slow while waiting for our bill. I brought my boyfriend a green goodness juice, made with Kale, apples, fennel, celery and whatever other green things I'm forgetting. It was healthy and delicious and I love that it was a menu option.
Ill return for dinner, and I look forward to everything but the bill!

Recommended by friends, I thought I'd try this place out while getting my car serviced across the street. 

I've looked at the menu before and it didn't look or sound like anything special. After dining here for 'In Between' I can officially say my friends tastes buds are shot. 

I ordered the Wagyu burger medium rare and was quite disappointed to have it delivered medium. The burger was still tasty however it was nothing spectacular. I do have to say the burger does reign over Gordon Ramsey BurGR at Planet Hollywood and Holsteins at Cosmopolitan. 

The fries that came with the burger were too salty and almost ruined the entire dish. 

I do have to say that the selection of tea was more exciting than the meal itself. The Organic Bangkok was an amazing tea with coconut from Harney & Sons. I'll be ordering that in the coming weeks. 

I was hoping since the  service started off great it would end great. Unfortunately the check was presented before the dessert menu. And I was looking forward to try the apple pie. Perhaps next time. 

Overall the place is good for a casual meet up, ok food and the occasional guy talking up the bartender drinking his green juice for his 30 day challenge...
Amazing food but croweded due to the new attraction

Excellent service, delicious food, great atmosphere. What more can you ask for?

The Biloxi chicken sandwich lives up to the hype and was absolutely delicious.

Absolutely loved this place.  The decor and feel of the restaurant is truly one of a kind.  The food is amazing,  everything we had was delicious and the flavors are on point. I can't wait to go back!

I had high hopes for this place, but it was just ok. 

I ordered the frittata, it listed the ingredients as spinach, garlic, potatoes, and cheese. They forgot to list tomatoes! It's filled with them and I hate tomatoes! Why would you list all the ingredients and leave out one major one? What if I was allergic?

Also, the host started vacuuming the front door area, while we were eating. I'm pretty sure that's a health code violation, kicking up all that dust while people are eating. 

I won't be back.

Our waitress was delightful. After some questions about the menu she disclosed she was fairly new but would find out. She came back before we blinked. I seriously forget her name but our blonde waitress she was a peach. We frequent honey salt a lot but this time what rubbed me the wrong way was the bread basket and honey butter. It's seriously what we rave about and it's literally the simplest thing  brought out complimentary. After our apps showed up and two rounds of drinks I asked if they do the bread basket anymore. The water boy came back and said "oh it's being warmed up it'll be right out." Ten minutes later the same gentleman said "oh here's our new thing" and dropped off one slice of what seemed to be wheat bread cut in half. If you don't have bread or crackers left just say so. Don't bring a slice of wheat bread cut in half and call it "your new thing". It won't stop us from coming but I've been to honey salt enough to know that's not a new thing.

I've been 6 times over the past couple of years and I honestly don't understand the hype. I keep trying hoping I've been missing something.

The service is about average (not bad, just nothing particularly special). 

The food is subpar. Except the pizza, which is really good. Everything else I've ever had needs seasoning and flavor.

The ambiance is ok, just not my style. It's too shabby chic for me, but I can appreciate that it appears well done.

Overall, I think there are better options in Summerlin.

Pre- sitting:  I would give the atmosphere 5 stars, but the service and food 3 stars.  Overall a cool place, but not a destination restaurant and a bit pricey.  It is hard when a new restaurant has such a big hype, because if one thing goes wrong it is a let down.  I waited at the bar for my friends to arrive- not one person offered me anything.  Asking if I wanted a water would've been a nice hospitable touch.  The hostesses are very friendly, which makes it a welcoming environment when you first walk in!  

Table: We sat and I glanced over the menu and was searching desperately for some cool, home-made breakfast bakes, and some fun noshy items to share, but monkey bread was all we came up with so we started with that.  I ordered a cappuccino and unfortunately it came out luke warm and I had to return it.  The monkey bread was good, but it was drowning in butter and was missing something..a bit heavy on the bread and not enough flavor.  The server was polite, but not as on top of things as I expected reading the service reviews.  We tried the salmon, breakfast pizza and heirloom salad.  ALL the food was good, but a bit overpriced.  If this restaurant was in San Fran or LA it wouldn't stand out at all.

Summary: I will definitely try this place again for dinner if I am in the area visiting a friend in Summerlin, but wouldn't go out of my way.  If I lived closer I would come in and grab a glass of wine and get an app at the bar, because as I mentioned- the atmosphere is stunning!

I'd been to Honey Salt a couple times for dinner & didn't love it. Or really like it. Hearing the menu is different for brunch/lunch, I gave it a shot & went for the Chick-fil-a'esque sandwich. Goodness, it's deliciousness! Anyway, a friend who hadn't been to Honey Salt wanted to go there for dinner. We started with the turkey meatballs, she got the salmon & I got the chicken. We thoroughly enjoyed everything: the salmon had a clean taste & was quite refreshing & the chicken was prepared perfectly & the au jus & slightly spicy mac & cheese were a tasty compliment. The desserts speak for themselves... even not being sold on Honey Salt a year ago, I always raved that I could go there just for dessert. But, I'm sold now on the other stuff on the menu!

One of our new fav restaurants!!!! Amazing food, service, and ambiance! We will be going back bc too many good items to try at once. Food was wonderful and full of flavor! Bread pudding was one of the best Ive had and caramel ice cream was great!!! Heelloooo drink was yummy

Honey Salt was amazing! We came for brunch and got some fun brunch cocktails and everything was superb! My friend and I got bottomless mimosas and everyone was very accommodating. Katie went above and beyond to make sure we had a good experience. We will be back!

Food was delicious! Ambiance top notch. Fun, classy decor to look at everywhere you turn. Our server was super attentive and ready with menu suggestions and recommendations. We will absolutely be back and bring our friends! :)

Yes Melissa totally redeemed my last trip here...   I came back for the good and now the service reflects what I ate.  Melissa good job dealing with my PIA friend who was out of line for something so petty.  (That was not a test she just has no manners). I had a crab cake Benedict, my friend had the frittata and momma Lia had the Biloxi friend chicken sand.  Bottomless blood orange mimosas to counteract my obnoxious friend made it A++++.  My Benny was so delicious that I wanted to lick the plate and I am not really a hollandaise fan.  If you are looking for a cool place to eat with a show stopping menu and casual/fine fine service come here and ask for Melissa.

My 2nd time here....first time was nice, second time not so much. I was seated and waited 7 minutes to even be acknowledged to get my drink order. Mind you it WASN'T busy!!! The table next to me got all of the service which ticked me off.....and it made me feel as if it was because of my ethnicity. Finally someone comes and takes my drink order....good thing I wasn't too thirsty! Happy hour menu is non-existent. I don't even know why they even have a happy hour with only a few items. Not sure if the food is good enough to come back!

Tips to the Business: 
Offer more Happy Hour choices
Give better service
Don't make people feel as if they are less important than other patrons.

Food is ok. Our waiter was really nice, but couldn't remember anything. He forgot my wife's entree, my friends salad, and my coffee. Everything eventually got fixed, but  it was odd because he had an order pad. It wasn't like he was trying to memorize everything. It got annoying. 

The look is very nice. They've opened up the middle where the bar was, and the restaurant is open and warm.  The bench all the way across one side is nice, and the mirrors are great. I think it has a great look and feel to the space. Much better to me than Nora's did. 

Like a lot of the other reviews, I think the noise is too much. They have music on pretty loud, and the way it's set up the noise of the other customers is enough and it becomes hard to hear the people you're sitting with

I really wanted to like it. I had a really nice night out. The problem is the food is disappointing (other than the bread pudding which was awesome), as it's average at best. The waiter was really nice and meant well, but didn't do so well. And, the noise is really an issue. I liked it, but no hurry to go back.

This was great new spot to venture for brunch. We ordered the grilled cheese and the burger with a side of broccoli paired with some pomegranate iced tea. The food was good overall but the grilled cheese was impeccably delicious. I just wished for a paired tomato bisque vs the given garden veggie minestrone. A return visit maybe in order to try the rest of their menu as well as their bar beverages.

Came here for brunch and this place was wonderful. The service was prefect I never had an empty glass and the food blew me away. It was so fresh and had such a great flavor I could taste every ingredient. I had the eggs Benedict with salmon and I was skeptical when I read it came on tomatoes but it was so good I highly recommend that dish. I can't wait to return

I absolutely love this place! It is quaint, cute, farm to table and good priced. 

I went with 5 moms for a brunch. We had a reservation and were seated right away. The food was amazing, 
Monkey bread cinnamon rolls, berry ricotta, breakfast pizza and corned beef hash. I also had a coffee and a blood orange bottomless mimosa. 

I'll say my mimosa saw the bottom too many times. Service was pretty good though I got the feeling at the end the server wanted her table back so they purposely dried us out of water and mimos

Nice ambiance and great service, but the food was a few notches below where it should be based on reputation and price. Not bad, just not close to amazing. Also, the cocktails are not up to par on what they should be. Frozen Peach pur√©e as opposed to freshly made in house peach, and a few of the signature cocktails using commercial low end spirits. Not worth it to be honest.

We were pretty disappointed, to say the least. 
FOOD: We came here for Sunday brunch. The menu was extremely limited. One of us ordered a lemon chicken salad , there was no trace of lemon and she said the dressing didn't taste citrus like either. Not sure if that's even what they gave her, but it's what was ordered. She also said the avocado was missing from her salad. Other friend ordered a chicken caeser and she was happy with it for the most part. Both of them said the portions were very small for a $15 salad. I opted for a bacon burger. It was $17. The burger itself was very good, however the fries were ice cold. After a 12-15 minute wait our server came back with fresh fries...but my friends were already done eating. 
SERVICE: server was very nice, but it was clear she was either under-trained or had too many tables. Regardless, she was extremely overwhelmed, and told us so. She did have a good attitude, and we were patient. 
We will likely try Honey Salt again in the future, although maybe for dinner instead of Sunday brunch.
I don't like the services but experiences I did like the hostess attitude never coming back

We were seated right away which is good because I don't like waiting around when there is visibly empty tables. We requested water to start with lemon and received just the water without lemon. We had to tell the busboy twice that we wanted lemon with our water, after about 10 minutes we got our lemon. I ordered the Cuban sandwich which was great, my wife ordered the chicken sandwich which she enjoyed as well. Our only complaint is the extremely slow service, it took nearly 45 minutes to get our food. Overall food was good but the slow service was the deal breaker, I don't want to spend over an hour eating lunch.

Wow, once again Honey Salt didn't disappoint. First, that butter.. Is it made in Heaven? I got the LINGUINE & CLAMS thinking there was no way I'd be able to finish after all that bread and butter that I ate and before I knew it I ate everything off my plate. The spices that were mixed in this dish blended perfectly making my tastebuds sing! Naturally I couldn't say no to dessert. I ordered the bread pudding and I was blown away! Hands down the best bread pudding I've ever had! 

My waiter was very friendly. There was a very big wedding party going on at that same time but that didn't keep him from checking in and making sure we were satisfied with our meals. 

Until next time Honey Salt!

I'm going to buck the trend of raves here but, will definitely return, try more dishes and give them time to work out service kinks. Jen S. set up a Sunday UYE luncheon which I'd really been looking forward to in this lovely, completely revamped spot.

I'd already decided perusing menu online that the quinoa/lentil salad would be my dish, as I'm pescy/veg these days; Tien had the same dish but with the intended free range chicken atop. While my dish was tasty, the value vs price factor was not there for me. Others raved about the "Crack Chick Fil A" sandwich and the burgers (I tasted one of Anthony's fries and it was good) the salad accompanying the chicken looked terrific and oddly, was almost the size of my whole dish (see photo) Everyone enjoyed their food, but the service hiccups were many: the meal took close to two hours and servers seemed downright confused splitting checks, delivering the correct dishes and keeping on top of water refills. I specified that I'm a fan of a very spicy Bloody Mary, and it was anything but...only saving grace was (once we figured out which was my drink on the several checks delivered) seeing that it was only $7. Christina enjoyed the pumpkin cheesecake and the bread pudding (huge!) was ordered by a few folks who seemed to really dig it, too. 

Again, the space was bright, airy and whimsical and it holds promise, but for me, the best part of my meal was the delightful company of fellow Yelpers. For a $28 lunch, there just has to be more: in portions (adding soup or the Green Goddess juice?) and service that is less scattered. Will definitely allow them some time to work on growing pains and still have hope for HS as the food was very good and the fresh/farm to table concept is welcome in Summahood.

* note: After this review, I was contacted to come back & identify myself. Not my style.*

I did, however, bring a Yelp Hurricane Sandy Fundraising flyer which the Hostess brought to Kim (who was sitting in Dining Room between lunch and dinner service and would not even address me or greet me) he sent Hostess back to relay "they are a new business and cannot help." I felt bad for her and was so turned off by his attitude = never support them again and I've stuck to that. 

They seem to be doing fab with the "see and be seen" Summahood crowd. More power to them. The Ipswich clams were on my radar, but rudeness trumped that desire.

This place is awesome! I am so so so so so so so happy we finally got to come here. My husband & I have been eating out a lot lately, and every place turns out to be meh, very mediocre, but this place lives up to the hype. It is FANTASTIC! We came on a Saturday & made reservations for 8. When we showed up, our couch was ready & we got to lounge while looking through the menu surrounding by their cute decor. It is very garage sale chic. 

We started off with the Cape Cod Fry or whatever it was called. It was delicious! Less than one month ago, I was at Disneyland and ate so much fried garbage that I vowed to never eat anything fried again but my husband really wanted this, so I succumbed and was happy we ordered it. Everything was very lightly fried (there were peppers, clams, and calamari rings) with high quality ingredients. For our entrees, I ordered "My Wife's Favorite Salad". Oh my goodness. I eat a lot of salad. Usually at least once a day, but this was my favorite salad ever. The duck confit was magnifique with that poached egg that oozed yolk all over my lightly tossed greens. I sometimes do not like fruit in my salad, but the pomegranate seeds & orange slices in this salad made it amazing. There was sweet, salty, crunchy, and indulgent (that fatty duck) which made this the perfect dish. 

My husband ordered the Filet which was SO tender. Oh my goodness. They gave him this steak knife that wasn't serrated so I was wondering how he was going to cut through this thing. That crappy knife cuts through this filet like butter. It tastes like butter. It melts in your mouth like butter. For $32, this steak was WELL worth it. If you're craving steak, DO NOT GO TO OUTBACK, come here instead! You get it on top of a bacon potato hash which is amazing! I wasn't a fan of their steak sauce though. It tasted like A1 with BBQ. Next time, I would ask for it on the side. We also got Mac & Cheese on the side (so yummy, cheesy, and creamy) as well as roasted cauliflower with kale (this was alright). For dessert, their baked in a brown bag apple pie with their salty caramel ice cream is a MUST. That ice cream definitely has chunks of salt in it, but is so good with the apple pie. They balance each other out perfectly, which is great, because I tend to dislike overly sweet thing. Overall, I am SO excited that we finally tried Honey Salt & we will certainly be back.

Tip: Make a reservation. My in-laws showed up on a Monday night. 1 hour wait. We came a couple of Fridays ago, 1 hour wait. Just make a reservation if you know you're coming. This place is always packed because it's AMAZING!!

Heard all they hype, so I was very excited when a client planned a meeting here! 
I checked out the reviews on YELP to see what was a must try! 

Walked in and was immediately greeted.. Love the decor.. simple & sweet and detailed. Unique look for Vegas.
 
Waitress was very friendly and attentive. 
Tried the Tuscan Bean soup. Nice with a light broth, beans and vegetables. It could have used a little salt, but overall good. 

I ordered the Big Eye Tuna!!!  Yum! Wasabi encrusted seared tuna.. served with a side spinach, pickled onion and orange rind salad. FRESH tasting and delicious. 

We passed on dessert although everything on the menu sounded fantastic!

Can't wait to go back for dinner, or lunch again to check out another item on the menu! Definitely a neighborhood place to suggest to friends.

Loved Honey Salt. The food was excellent, as well as the service.  Loved octopus appetizer, turkey meatballs, curried chicken and scallops. Everything was cooked to perfection.  The desserts were amazing, as well as my cappuccino made by Tulio.   This is a great restaurant not to be missed.

Out of the numerous times my wife and I have visited Honey Salt we have never had a bad meal.  This was also our first brunch experience with Kim Canteenwalla & E. Blau's Honey Salt and hopefully will not be our last.  They always have the cream of the crop servers who are both incredibly knowledgable of the menu items and extremely friendly.  We decided to come in for an impromptu lunch/brunch as we were entertaining friends and knew this would be a quality meal without destroying our bankroll (unlike my wife's spending habits-kidding).  Upon arriving the beautiful hostess Michelle said we could be accommodated even though we did not have any reservations. Once sat they took our drink order while offering delectable suggestions.  Never to early for Bourbon so I chose the Maple Old Fashioned any my wife decided to DD and went with a refreshing "Cool as a Cucumber".  We then ordered our entrees and I went with the Fried Chicken Sandwich on the onion brioche and the wife had the Seared Ahi Tuna Salad. Both were huge portions and I left pleasantly full but not obese. Can't wait to go back for my next bourbon Brunch.

I really like this place - in a strip mall but nice stores around it and the decor and ambiance are great. Plus I love the name honey  salt. Two of my favorite things! I had the burger and fries. Others in my party had the eggs Benedict with rave reviews and the steak salad - also rave reviews. The burger was done perfectly - so much so that I wish that I hadn't split it. The fries though were a huge disappointment. This coming from someone that rarely meets a fry I don't like...my bar is low. All the fries were left behind. Will be back - please make better fries!

I came here on Sunday for an impromptu brunch and was blown away not only by the food and endless blood orange mimosas, but by our server as well! Monica was her name and she was beyond accommodating and quite comedic as well! If you're looking for a modern atmosphere with great food and outstanding service, Honey Salt is your place!
This place off the strip but worth the drive if your looking for some great food. It is cute and cozy inside and the food and service is great.

I have had Honey Salt on my radar since moving to Las Vegas, but I hadn't made the trip until just recently with friends for lunch. It is in a corner spot on a strip mall and well situated parking.

I ordered the power lunch and had it with the tomato soup, fried chicken sandwich, and the bread pudding. Everything was good and tasted as one would expect. Nothing out of the ordinary though, so I'm not sure I would go back.

It was love at first sight.  As soon as I opened the doors and walked into this gorgeous space I wanted so badly to like the food... and was extremely relieved not to have been disappointed.  The place was covered with rustic bricks, great artwork, good-looking servers with matching good service.  A "boutique" restaurant with "boutique" food - a cross section between the comfort staples and froo-froo fare that does not skimp on seasoning.  

The New England fry-d calamari and mussels were divine - light, crispy with a tangy/slightly spicy sauce.  The charcuterie pizza had different salami and ricotta and fennel was excellent (but I thought it could've been served without the spicy oil).  My ahi salad was almost perfect - the spinach with pickled onions were... haunting, lol, for lack of a better term.  I so want to replicate it at home.  But the seared tuna's crust I think could be improved.  Maybe a little more salt and heat to play off the already sweet bed of jicama and asparagus.  The backyard burger my husband loved, but my brother in law complained about the salt levels.  The burger platters came with your own catsup bottle.  How can you not like this place?

Wish we had more time and space to try the desserts.  I swear they were calling my name on our way out.  Honey salt you are a perfect balance of the very things that tug at my palette and my personality.  I want more.

Reservations were right on time and the food was so good! I had the chef's special 14oz NY Strip and the wife had the 8 oz filet. Both steaks were cooked PERFECT! That is hard to come by even in a lot of steak places. Of course for dessert she had the Brookie and I had the chocolate layer cake. Both were amazing as always! The bill was about $101 b4 tip w/o alcohol. A little pricy but so worth it!!!

I had high expectations...I always screw myself when that happens. But for all its hype, Honey Salt just fell short for me.

The service was good. Everything came out in a timely manner and everyone was friendly. I liked the decor too. Understated, with a touch of elegance.

The complimentary bread service was delightful: a soft, sweet whole wheat roll and crispy lavash. But it was served with a bland bean pur√©e. There's a couple of things I have a problem with here. I understand serving it with the lavash, but the roll? Nah, homey. That thing screamed for butter (I asked for some and they obliged me). Also, the pur√©e had some crushed pink peppercorns in it which, to me, didn't make sense culinarily and was a bit off putting.

For an appetizer, we shared the "New England Fry": a combination of clams (with the belly) and calamari. I'm not sure what they battered them in...maybe semolina or polenta? But they weren't as crispy as I'd like them to be. The creamy sauce had a little kick, which I liked and it was served with blistered whole shishito chiles. I would've preferred them sliced and pickled because the dish could use some acid. Overall, the flavor was there, but lacked some finesse.

My wife ordered the salmon. Pretty ordinary. It was also rare in the middle. I like my salmon med rare or medium, but this was rare. The garnishes (peppadew sauce and quinoa pilaf) were good by themselves, but couldn't stand up to the big flavor of the fish. Overall, this dish felt muddled and confused.

I chose the scallops. Definitely the star of the show. The roasted cauliflower and herb salad it was served with were delicious. I did have some problems with this plate, though. Lets just keep vanilla where it belongs, shall we? Good in dessert. Does not belong in my cauliflower pur√©e. Also, I detected no truffle flavor in the "truffle" sauce. The scallops, though, were perfectly cooked and this more than made up for the minor indiscretions.

The Mac and Cheese was very good, as well. I liked that they added some peppers and kale to it. It gave the flavor a subtle vegetal quality which was welcome.

Overall, the food fell flat. Kinda like this review. Meh...

My family went here yesterday because we had an out of town visitor. We have a young child so we typically go one to any restaurants website first to scope out what we are going to order. I looked on their own website and decided on the Shrimp Scampi. 

When we arrived, they were not busy at all. There is much construction go my on you could hardly tell where the restaurant was. The construction guys are indiscriminately dropping pieces of the facade off the roof and down to the cement walkway where customers are walking so watch out for falling objects! We were seated and the waiter came right over. Their happy hour ends at six and a few people in our party wanted a glass of wine. They asked if they could get an order in during happy hour which was ending in about five minutes. The waiter grumbled but agreed. I was the DD so I ordered a coke. I looked at the menu he gave us and didn't see the Shrimp Scampi dish so I asked about it. The waiter told us that the menu changes seasonally and that I shouldn't trust websites like yelp to predetermine my meal (he said this in condescending way and with a bit of attitude for some reason). I told him that YOUR website advertises it on the menu, and he said "well someone should change that then shouldn't they?" And he walked off. 

He brought out everyone's wine, and asked if he can get us anything else. I asked for my coke that I ordered and he said, "oh yeah I'll grab that" and kind of stood there. I told him I'd like the drink now as no one is ready to order because at least three of us were going to order the Shrimp Scampi. 


Two people ordered the Scallops which were extremely salty but other than that were ok. The other two people order a burger and salmon which they said was fine. I ordered the chicken which was super dry, the Mac and cheese looked old, and I didn't even try the broccoli that was served as a side. At the end of the meal I asked for a coffee which was like warm and very weak and some people ordered dessert. The dessert seemed to be the best thing we had as everyone agreed they were good. 


The reason for the two star review was that our waiter gave me attitude for inquiring about a dish on their own website and the general mediocrity of the food in addition to the heavy construction going on. I doubt I'll be back but my wife has raced about the brunch their so she will probably still eat here.

I love to try local places vs chain restaurants when I go out. This place is a keeper!! The food is fresh and delish  Service is good and the taffy you can grab at the end of the meal on your way out is yummy. Next time I visit Vegas I'll be back.
Got the clams and calamari to go. Very greasy and had to pour oil out of container. Would not return here for seafood

I've heard a lot of rave reviews about Honey Salt, but was a little disappointed after finally trying it out. We went here (party of two) for Sunday Brunch and were able to OpenTable a reservation for noon (placed reservation at 11am) so we didn't have to wait. We ended up waiting anyway, with a party of 8 walking in just after us but still getting seated first (after overhearing they didn't have a reservation, but they knew someone). 

It took a really long time to talk to a server, whom we saw only once more when he came to bring us our check (that we had to request from someone else). Also, the servers don't wear nametags and wear jeans/plain shirts, so it can be hard to tell who is a customer and who is a server.

We ordered the Monkey Bread to start, which even though it wasn't to my taste, my boyfriend said was the best he'd ever had. He ordered the steak & egg sliders with breakfast potatoes and raved about the potatoes. I ordered the backyard burger and it was a decent burger, but nothing to write home about. Prices were a little steep. 

I ordered a soft drink, he ordered an ice tea, and our glasses sat empty for most of the meal after we polished off our drinks halfway through the monkey bread starter. Not sure if you have to ask for refills or if you are charged extra, but that was a little annoying. 

One other thing - this place is LOUD and there is very little to absorb the noise. I've been in larger and equally packed rooms and not had it be as loud as it was here. 

Some of the dishes were good, but the slow/inattentive service and noise level will probably stop us from coming back.

We had lunch reservations but ended up waiting about 15 minutes before we were seated as only one busser was working. Two star rating mainly is for poor service; plenty of servers bustling around but  took forever to have someone take our order, and then none bothered to check in with us. Perhaps we shouldn't have been surprised  that this oh-so-trendy yuppy place but paid huge attention to the celebrity there. Very noisy and tables close together. Food is so-so; overpriced for what you can get better and cheaper at similar restaurant.

My go to place whenever I am traveling through Las Vegas!!!! The Brick Oven Chicken is the best and the mac&cheese....YES!!!!! The staff is very friendly and they seem to remember you. It almost feels like family.....I will never leave you Honey Salt...Please never leave me!!!!

Very quaint spot, Cozy and modern. 
The food was good, I was disappointed with the portions. Our waiter said it was family style but I'm not sure what size family he meant because for a party of 3 small women, it was barely enough for us.  He was kind but not super attentive. We also had drunk all of our water and without us requesting another bottle, they brought one. Only thing is, we didn't know we were being charged for it without our consent.
The brown bagged apple pie with salted caramel ice cream was superb however, as well as the white sangria.

The decor and concept are really nice and the staff was super friendly.  The bottom less mimosas for brunch are a really good deal and offer variety with a belini and blood orange mimosa option.  I wasn't impressed with my breakfast sandwich.  I did however enjoy the tomato jam component of it, which really was a fancy ketchup.  I have experienced their dinner here and if I recall correctly the food was much better then. Our servers were super helpful and attentive.

This place is great for a special sit-down dinner or a casual bite at the bar. Staff is relaxed and knowledgable about the menu which is helpful. Scallops are divine. Love the kale caesar salad, mac n cheese, brussel sprouts.. All solid. It's pretty easy to make a meal out of the smaller dishes and sides. And if they have it on the menu, the pumpkin bundt cake dessert is fantastic.

I think this restaurant is extremely overrated. Every time I go, the food is great, but it's not the best. I find the dining area to have poor acoustics. It's almost too loud to hear the next person next to you. It's a real struggle. 

I've only ever gone for brunch. But, I would be interested in trying out dinner once the construction in that plaza is done.
What a great place to take your mom on Mother's Day for bottomless mimosas. The food was so flavorful and presentable. The staff was friendly too.

Pros: beautiful ambience, tasty, old-fashioned American food, and great service. 
Cons: Overpriced, tendency to overcook.

Honey Salt is a homey, well-rounded, professional American high-end sit-down restaurant/steakhouse. The restaurant's ambience, color arrangements, furniture designs, and setup were phenomenal; couldn't have asked for more out of this type of American cuisine chef-run place. The Charred Filet Mignon was overcooked fairly heavily (though I requested Medium). Entrees overall otherwise were phenomenal, with a wide range of taste profiles and menu options, also with your traditional Free Range Chicken and Filet Mignon. Appetizers were great as well: I highly recommend the octopus and balsamic tomato salad. The octopus appetizer dish had good portions, and an AMAZING sauce for $15.00 which was a decent deal for large portions at such a high-end venue. Unfortunately, the suckers on the tentacles of the octopus were slightly charred/burned, and some were quite underdone. If you find a well done piece, you are guaranteed to love it. 

I would recommend trying the: octopus appetizer, balsamic tomato appetizer, quinoa appetizer, Free Range Chicken entree, and Medium/Medium-Rare (they tend to overcook) Filet Mignon. 

Thanks to Honey Salt for a overall fabulous restaurant experience!

This gem of a restaurant is tucked into the corner of a retail square near Boca Park, in Summerlin. 
I spend half of my year in Vegas working and frequent many of the local restaurants. Honey Salt is one of my favorites. Although good food and good service is a must have, my colleague and I look for a wee bit more than that. At Honey Salt, we have gotten to know the wait staff, the support staff and the managers. When we arrive, we are greeted warmly, and treated as one of the family. I hate to throw out the Cheers analogy, but heck, it's like Cheers. 

We have frequented other restaurants where the atmosphere is a bit too stuffy for my liking, so we don't return. The Honey Salt Restaurant  is like comfort food that calms and satisfiesLiving in a hotel room for half the year, it's therapeutic to be greeted with wonderful smiles and a warm reception. 
Our last waiter, (see photo), Adrian, is attentive and works hard to make sure that our visit suns smoothly. Be sure to order a salad so he can pepper it up with his Samurai Sword pepper grinder!
