My friend asked if they had chocolate milk for her 5 1/2 year old.  They don't normally have it on their menu, but they managed to make one for him, which he loved.

We both ended up ordering the same thing off their Power Lunch menu.  I thought the courses were going to be served one by one, but the cesar salad was served with the fried chicken sandwich and fries I wanted.  Everything was very tasty and I enjoyed it all before the strawberry sorbet came out after we were done with everything else. The slaw in the sandwich could have been served as a side, it was very tasty.

Ambiance here reminded me of the hip and cool restaurants that you'd find in downtown San Diego (The Gaslamp) where I live.  It's a great spot for locals to enjoy since the food is great and the restaurant itself is very pretty on the eyes.  If anything, I would have probably enjoyed my salad first instead of it coming out with my fries and sandwich since I was alternating what I was eating with the three options on my plate all at the same time.  I know, first world problems.

It can be a little confusing when trying to find out who your server was since the gal that originally poured our waters and brought out other drinks did only that.  Our actual server barely showed up to take our order and another guy brought out our food.  Very little interaction with our server guy, I actually preferred the gal since she was a lot more friendly with us and made us feel welcomed.

I loved the honey lemon(?) salt scrub that they provided in the ladies room, that was a nice touch.  I love salt scrubs, but after learning it costs $30 to buy theirs in a mason pint-sized jar, I didn't love it as much as I thought since I refused to spend that much to take one home with me, lol.

This is a cute little hidden restaurant within the same plaza as PF Changs right in the corner so it can be easy to miss. Their ambiance and decor has a sort of modern vintage vibe. One wall is decorated with framed mirrors while the other is a brick wall their "Honey Salt" written across it.

Our server was attentive and got me everything I needed without me having to ask for it.

We decided to go with the Ahi Tuna Tartare as a starter and then the Seared Ahi Tuna and Mary's Free Range Brick Oven Chicken Breast for entrees. Our server brought out our starter and then the bread & butter afterwards, thought that was a little weird - not a big deal.

Ahi Tuna Tartare: Comes with a few pieces of toasted bread. Full of flavor as soon as you bite into it - but it is quite small. 

Seared Ahi Tuna: Boyfriend loved it but he was still hungry afterwards. Came with a little side salad and about 6-7 pieces of ahi tuna. I obviously stole a piece and the flavoring was amazing on it.

Mary's Free Range Brick Oven Chicken Breast: I was afraid that this would be just a lump of dry chicken at first glance but it wasn't! As soon as I bit into it, it was juicy, it tastes even better if you dip it into the natural jus. The skin was also nice and crispy which adds more texture to the dish. Below the chicken was a few pieces of macaroni which I pretty much ate in one bite.

Overall, if you're starving and expecting large portions, don't come here! The price can be a bit high but I understand that the quality of food makes up for it. This wouldn't be a regular go-to spot for me but I would consider coming back on a special occasion to try some other dishes.

We initially read about this place as the best restaurant in Vegas off the strip. My thoughts are it is an awesome place, cool vibe, great food and great service. The only complaint was my wife thought maybe the scallops she had were a bit undercooked maybe but I didnt think so. The comfort food Sunday chicken, mac cheese were great. The shrimp lettuce cups were really good also. I would recommend and will check it out again.

It's funny how I heard of this place: They "hearted" one of my pictures on Instagram, of all things.  Far better than the same club promoters that love every single Vegas thing I post in an attempt to get me to reserve tables and bottle service.

But I digress.

Fortunately, due to seeing pics of their tasty foods online, the Missus and I decided to pay them a visit.

The ambience has kind of a "Hip Homemade" vibe to it.  Their drinks (blood orange mimosas) are tasty and colorful, and while I like their chicken tacos and burgers, their fried chicken sandwich is to die for.  I'm trying to be better about my eating by not fixating on just one "favorite", and while everything I've tried has been full of flavor and very good, that fried chicken sandwich is the business.

Prices are reasonable, service is pleasant, and I really like the atmosphere.  The bathroom walls (well, men's anyway - I can't vouch for what mysterious marvels the women's bathroom offers) showcases a full wall of classic baseball cards, which is fun to browse through all the old players, and it's in a good spot near Boca Park.

Great lunch.  Haven't done dinner yet, but the food is consistently good, and really shows off a lot of pride and effort.

You keep "hearting" away, Honey Salt.  In this case, it worked for getting my business.

Nice restaurant located in the Summerlin area. We went here on a Friday night for two. My friend made a reservation which I would suggest so you don't have to wait because the place was pretty packed. There's a nice place to seat outside too, but I'm not sure if they only serve drinks outside. 

Our server was very friendly. We got the specialty of the night which was the peach salad, it was pretty yummy. The calamari was very good. I ordered the grilled Salmon, it was perfection. 

Make sure to try their salt scrub in the ladies room, our server mentioned it when I asked her where the restrooms are located. 

Definitely recommend this place, a little on the $$ side but it's worth It.

Dude TERRY is u real.  An amazing mixologist I can't believe he's not on the strip! He made me a gin martini with muddled English peas that is something I would never ever think to concoct and it was amazing!  And he made a sailor Jerry and amaretto with ginger beer and fruit mixture that was amazing!!!    Thanks Terry u the real OG!

My boyfriend surprised me with VDay dinner here! We really enjoyed the atmosphere. Hostess was nice, and we got seated right away. The decor was beautiful and we sat at a high table off to the side of the bar that was a little more private than the main dining room - it was perfect.

Never got our waiter's name but he was nice. Definitely in a hurry and rushing though, we barely saw him.. but the place was packed so I understand. Both of us ordered the 3-course VDay menu for $60 per person. Major downside was that our entrees took 45 minutes to come out after we had our appetizers. Waiter kept coming back like he was shocked they still hadn't arrived... so were we.

BUT the food was great and the presentation was outstanding. Try the pink lemonade tequila cocktail!

..the portions were tiny for the price but I understand that's what special holiday menus usually are, and $60 is great compared to the $125 minimums that you find at other restaurants on Valentine's Day.

Would love to come back to enjoy happy hour and the regular menu.

12 empty tables and a 25 minute wait? Guess I'll eat somewhere else, 2 stars because I've eaten here before and the food is good but poor table management. This is probably my 6th time here, I went to the opening which was a train wreck which openings sometimes are like that. Thought I would try again and the next two times were great experiences all the way around, the next time was horrible, service was really bad and the hostess was clueless. Tried again which was good then today...so if you get lucky it can be a great experience.

Great Sunday brunch spot! Loved the vibe of the restaurant! The decor is so lovely. They have a cool outside patio eating area as well. We had the breakfast pizza and salmon eggs benedict both were really good. The Monkey Bread is awesome! The service was good.

Honey Salt is by FAR my favorite place to eat in Las Vegas.
As a local foodie, Honey Salt is a dream come true. The atmosphere, the service, and most of all the FOOD are nothing short of perfect. The menu is seasonal, and that being said it changes quite frequently but the quality of the food is consistently great!
Amazing as always! Katie at the bar kills it at the bar. She makes an amazing Negroni and is funny as shit!

I don't hand out 5 stars.  I am generally a 4 starer when I like an establishment.  So, here comes the love.

I had read about Honey Salt and had been wanting to try it for a while.  I hadn't had cause to be near Boca Park.  But a friend of mine wanted to go out for Saturday brunch and I remembered the lovely things I had heard about this place.  (ahem, endless mimosas)

We both agreed to endless mimosas, so our lovely server started us off with blood orange.  Our second round was more of the same and our third round (which we couldn't finish, I know weak) was a concoction that our server made up.  It was the best yet, but two was actually my limit.

I asked for some recommendations from the menu.  The server mentioned the bacon grilled cheese with tomato soup and I was thought that sounds amazing!  And it was.  The large and crispy bacon pieces inside of the melty gooey cheese took me to heaven.  The tomato soup has a little bit of a spicy kick.  Also, there was so much food, I got to take half of my sandwich home and enjoy it another time.

I had really intended to eat one of the delectable sounding breakfast options, but alas, all that means is I must return to try the french toast or eggs benedict or ...

The decor was nice and comfortable, throw pillows on the benches.  I like that they left a water bottle at the table so we could refill ourselves.  The service was one the money.  The place was super clean.  Truly an enjoyable experience.  Next time, I will bring the hubby so we can share dishes.

I wish California had a place like this - the decor was very rustic.

Our server wasn't very tentative, we had to always flag him down or someone who just happened to walk by. There were a bunch of empty tables so they weren't super busy. 

I ordered the shrimp linguini and my client ordered the flat iron steak. My pasta was average, shrimp tasted a bit fishy as for my client she her steak was flavorless - she asked for a side of horseradish to make her steak more edible. The food presentation was good but not sure I would come - their dinner menu didn't have any options. 

The dessert on the other hand - apple pie and brookie were really good.

We walked in here without a reservation on a Saturday night and ate at the bar.  I am super late on the Honey Salt bandwagon.  So much so that I might as well be writing a review on this cool new show called "Breaking Bad".  I mean, the buttermilk fried chicken sandwich has similar qualities to meth...so I've heard anyways.  

The creamless corn soup intrigued my wife the most and she loved it.  The charred kernels and arugula oil was kind of a shock at initial taste but it grew on her quickly and she already plans to order it the next time we're there.  

I got "My Wife's Favorite Salad" consisting of duck confit, arugula, fris√©e, pine nuts, roasted bing cherries, and a farm fresh poached egg.  This was terrific and I only wished there was even more duck but I am sure everyone feels that way.  I thought the mix of flavors were really good.  

We split the Colorado Lamb porterhouse for the entree.  It came with bacon sofrito, pea tendrils, roasted fingerling potatoes, and balsamic reduction.  I'd never had lamb prepared this way and thought it was quite creative.  The lamb was a little more done than I wanted it to be but it was still juicy.  Like all good porterhouses, I found myself gnawing on the bone with my bare hands at the end.  

Our super friendly (and fellow Red Sox fan from Andover, MA) bartender lightly twisted our arm into getting "The Brookie" for dessert which the menu describes "chocolate chip cookie meets chocolate fudge brownie, with vanilla bean ice cream".  You should definitely try this if you like but are really tired of chocolate lava cake.  I feel so jaded typing that last sentence.  

Overall it was great.  What's not to like about this spot?

Went for brunch on a Saturday and had the breakfast pizza and the French toast - both were delicious! Our server was Dominique and she was delightful, always checking in on us and making sure we were happy with the meal. I would definitely return.

I was about to give this place 4 stars and realized why not 5 The service was excellent, prompt and not overwhelming or annoying. My water was always filled. The ambiance is bright and great for picture taking. This place also helps the Las Vegas community, at the moment they are assisting a local elementary school to grow a garden of fresh vegetables.

On to the food. Their menu is not super big, but that is okay because the way the food is prepared and laid out is farm to table. I had the burger, protein style so no bread, with a side ceaser salad and a blood orange drink that was delicious. I was impressed by everything. The portion size, the freshness of the food, and the presentation of the meal. The food was delicious. I will be back to try more things on this menu. I also heard they are changing up their menu every so often putting new things on and taking others off which I thought was very smart for keeping customers happy and coming back. With such a limited menu I would say it is hard not to change things up, but I thought they did a great job with that.

Otherwise I just have to say I really loved this place, was shocked almost by how much, and maybe next time I will try a dessert! I will be back for more honey salt!

The restaurant is very cute and hip. I was underwhelmed with the menu choices, but food is farm to table. Very nice presentation for food that is alright. Three stars because the service was not spectacular. Will possibly try again and hope for better service.

First timers and the service is terrible. They have people who even help servers get your drinks and it took 10 mins. Then we didn't know of their limited menu for Sunday. Not impressed. Will not be back

I was excited to try this place finally after seeing so may people post/talk about this place. The decor is cute without a doubt, we went in between the lunch and dinner rush so it was pretty quiet. I was surprised at how "small" the menu was, I had just imagined their menu to have a little more variety and nothing really stood out of the menu and screamed "Try me!". I decided on the ahi flatbread pizza, which it came out served as literally just ahi pieces thrown on top of a (pretty) flatbread pizza with a smooth avocado spread (would have loved it chunky for a textural component). The flatbread was crispy on the outside and airy in the inside, perfect! And pretty good with the avocado spread but no cohesion with the ahi. I just picked off the ahi from the top and ate it separately. I'm no chef but I could tell you this dish needed an acid element! I wish they had done something to tie the ahi ("star ingredient") better into the dish. Pretty plating, but basic flavors. I was disappointed and was left thinking "that's it?" And for $18 if I recall correctly. I was going to check out but got talked into the salted caramel brownie dessert, let's give them another shot. Waaaaaay too sweet to even enjoy. Sweet on sweet, it was way too much for me. It seems like a no-brainer with the ingredients/name of the desert but I was really hoping they had nailed the sweet and salty aspect to create a balance dessert but again, disappointed. This place was so hyped up and I didn't get for what? Maybe the cute decor ;)

Had an amazing dinner at honeysalt! It was my first time here and our waiter Nick helped us through the menu. We decided to do a family style dinner to be able to sample each dish. We had the squash blossoms stuffed with ricotta, calamari with a romesco sauce, pan seared scallops with a truffle sauce, brick chicken on Mac & cheese, halibut with a carrot ginger sauce, swordfish with artichokes, and filet mignon. One of the most amazing dinners I've ever had. It's often hard to find a restaurant that does every dish well. I definitely plan to comeback!

This is a restaurant that benefited very much from second impressions. I first went to Honey Salt for restaurant week and was pretty significantly disappointed. At the end of the day the food was just okay, nothing special, and no matter how awesome the honey salt butter actually was, delicious butter can only go so far. Although hot damn the butter went pretty far.  If I had made a review on the restaurant week menu it would be 3 stars at best.

And yet, I was coerced into coming back. Reviews are just generally very positive so I wanted to give it another shot and ultimately that was a very good decision. I've been back two times once for dinner and once for brunch.

Dinner:

Squash Blossoms- an interesting appetizer certainly, basically fried squash and cheese but fairly tasty I will say that.

Salmon- honestly it was a great salmon dish. A lot of vegetables, salmon cooked very well, pesto all over. Overall a very satisfying dish.

Peach Cobbler- the big seller here is the seasonal dessert. The opportunity to have desserts that change with the seasons is very fun and worth coming back for. The Cobbler was really amazing too. Really got the peach flavor coming through.

Brunch:

Monkey bread- very tasty sugary delight. A huge plate too. Could have made me full all on its own if I was a lesser man.

Eggs benedict- As far as eggs benedict goes I'd say it was above average. Did it blow me away? No. But It's far better than anything I can do which is more than enough for me. 

As a side note the decor of the restaurant is also really nice. It's a really cozy feel and the brick designs work really well.

So the key question here is why 4 not 5 stars. Obviously Ive claimed the food is pretty good and it's a fun environment.  But the key word here is 'pretty.'  There was nothing that blew me away in terms of the food. The dessert was the closest but one dessert item just simply isn't enough to seal the deal. Although it's priced reasonably well and that's certainly a plus for a Vegas restaurant, it's just not out of this world. I'll be back though I know that.

I made a brunch reservation for myself and six of my friends.  When I arrived a 14-top walk-in had just taken up the table I reserved so we were relegated to sitting outside.  In December.  It took me asking twice and an additional 15 minutes for the server to come get our drink order.  Throughout the meal we didn't receive a coffee refill without asking and then waiting at least five minutes.  I ordered steak and eggs, medium rare and poached.  I got a medium well steak and raw eggs.  The egg white wasn't cooked and they were ice cold.  I would have sent it back, but I didn't see him again for an hour.  When we finally tracked him down to get the bill, we asked for it to be split.  He told us it would "take too long" so I began to split it on my own.  He came back and slapped the newly separated bills on the table and left.  

I am embarrassed because I highly recommended Honey Salt.  It fell far below my expectations and I feel foolish for recommending it to my friends.  It was an abysmal experience and was no where near the $25 per person cost for inedible food and horrible service.  

I do not recommend this restaurant.
Jade was so awesome!!!!!!! Helped a lot , knew a lot about the menu- waitress was super busy so jade took over!
Great food. Local ownership. Quaint decor and location. My family has been MANY times, and service is always top notch.
This place is sooooooo cute! The servicer was super nice and took the corn soup off my bill because it was wayyy too salty. Atmosphere was perfect and the dessert was the best!

My mom and I had dinner here recently and it was an outstanding experience.  We had a reservation but had to wait a few minutes for a table.  Not too long.  The restaurant was very loud in the main area but we were seated on the side which was much quieter.  

We decided to save room for dessert so we did not have appetizers.  For entrees, mom had the short ribs.  They were pull apart tender.  Really tasty.  I had the leftovers the next day and they were really tasty.  There was flounder fish special on the menu that night so that is what I had.  The fish was flaky and soft.  There was fennel and citrus on top.

We also had the salt & pepper fries.  Crispy on the outside, soft inside.  Not too peppery.  I had the white sangria to drink.  It was very tasty, bubbly.  They have a full bar so mom had a Bombay Sapphire and tonic.  She enjoyed it.  For dessert, we had the brown bag baked apple pie with vanilla ice cream.  The apple pie was really yummy.  The crust was nice and flaky.  Soft apples.  Ice cream was good too.

We definitely will be back.  The food was yummy.  Service was excellent.  Fun place.

Food was good! but the service was below average. Had to ask for a refill a couple times and only saw the waiter once. Ended up side tipping the runner since he basically was our waiter for the night. We went on a weekend at about 9 PM and it was pretty packed, so the hostess said we would wait for a bit, which was fine, until we realized the yuppy owner was allowing her friends to be seated without a wait. (usually this is fine, but it happened 4 or 5 times). Overall the food was good, just needs to work on customer service!

Had a delicious afternoon meal with my husband today at Honey Salt!  Everyone there was very welcome, attentive & accommodating ( I am a very specific diner ) the ambience was amazing and the juice and our meals were scrumptious!  Can't wait to come back!
Everything was awesome. Real fresh and tasty. Randy's service was perfect very knowledgeable about the menu.

No doubt the restaurant is beautiful and lively! Also, the hostess was spectacular and nice. It's a must to sit down and savor the colors and decorations of this warm environment... but the food? Not so much. Very disappointed with the food. 

Our steaks were flavorless and so bloody :( the top was burnt and didn't make the bland meat any better. 

The fries too salty and the kids pasta was drenched in melted butter. Distasteful. Maybe this place is a hit or miss, I'm not sure.

What a find!  Thanks, Yelpers!  We were hiking in Red Rocks and on our way back to the strip when we yelped this place. At 2 pm, we were after the lunch menu and before dinner so the menu was extremely limited.  There were also out of a lot of beers that we asked for.  The food is terrific!  The free crackers and honey butter are awesome.  The turkey meatball pizza and the veggie pizza were tasty. I added a side caesar which was not on the menu.  The burgers looked good.  The apple crumble and the brownie were fabulous.  The ambience inside and in the restroom is very quirky and fun. Make sure to use the sea salt scrub in the restrooms!

Came for brunch last week and I love the farm to table deal they have going on. Our server Adrian was funny and definitely a humble guy. I'll be coming back again to visit Adrian and enjoy the fresh food!!

You had me at $18 bottomless mimosas!! I enjoyed this place, I feel that in my opinion it wasn't as good as everyone has been saying but it could have been what I ordered. I also would want to try this place for dinner. But me & my friends came in for brunch. We were able to try all the mimosas and our favorite was definitely the Bellini. We couldn't even finish our third round. We also ordered monkey bread & chips for the table. I ordered the corned beef hash which is actually corn beef lol (the Asian in me thought it was the other kind of corned beef hash) which had two poached eggs, seasoned potatoes, spinach, and some Brussels sprouts. I only gave this place four stars with hopes of editing my review after trying their dinner menu. Overall the service was really good even with a full house. Their open kitchen and the restaurant atmosphere makes it very "cozy" and perfect for breakfast.

With all the hype, I had to go.  From the moment I walked in I felt more welcomed than almost any other restaurant in Las Vegas.  Two hostesses and the manager all made me feel like I was a superstar as I walked in.  My first thought was I was the only customer but the place was nearly full.  My daughter and I were seated at a table with a couch (of course the 8 year old got the couch) and the atmosphere was welcoming and lively.  Our waitress was cute as a button and very helpful about the menu.  She made some suggestions and ultimately I tried the free range chicken.   I was prepared for the dry stringy meat that made me gravitate away from chicken at many restaurants.  I don't know whether it was the free range, the cooking style, or some magic pixie dust but this was the best piece of chicken I ever ate.  The skin was crisp and the meat moist and flavorful.  The sauce was delightful.  Even the mac and cheese underneath was superb.  My daughter got the pasta with brown butter and parmesan.  Although we were a little surprised the pasta was elbow macaroni, she still loved it.  The whole wheat rolls and flatbread with a bean puree were very good as well.  For desert, my daughter had a snow cone (first time i have seen that in restaurants.  What kid doesn't love a snow cone.  I had the brown bag apple pie with vanilla ice cream.  YUM.  I WANT MORE.   Their drinks are also creative.  I only tried one martini because I was driving but next time, I will find a designated driver so I can try more.

All in all this is a great addition to Summerlin.  I was a little sticker shocked at the final bill partly because they don't list the prices well for the kids menu and partly because the items are a little pricey but it is well worth it and still cheaper than most places on the strip.

Go to Honey Salt! it is a great experience.

This place is so friggin cute. I love the d√©cor!

The menu is a little bit confusing because depending on the time of day, they have a different menu.. so at dinner time, if I feel like their delicious grilled cheese sandwich, I can't order it! at all!

Needless to say, try their Smoked Beehive Grilled Cheddar Cheese during LUNCH. It's such a delicious combination of flavors, I can't really describe it.. a little salty, a little smoky, and a whole lot of cheese.

We also tried Mary's Free Range Chicken. I've never had quinoa before so it was a little interesting for me.. but the chicken was tasty and tender.

There's so many other things I want to try here!

Only downfall is prices are a bit hefty, but I imagine you are also paying for the ambience, which is on point!

Honey Salt is a great off-Strip dining option. Be sure to make a reservation if it's a weekend evening, the restaurant was packed with locals by about 7pm.

Every dish we ordered here was good: charred octopus, charcuterie & cheese, New England fry, caramelized sea scallops, Nana's Tiffin chicken curry, Colorado lamb porterhouse, mac and cheese, roasted cauliflower, triple strawberry shortcake, warm bread pudding and brookie. The food was more than enough to feed a group of 5 (we have big appetites) and we all left full and happy for about $50 each. 

Bonus tip: try out the honey salt exfoliating scrub in the restroom and leave with extra soft hands!
Love the feel of this place, chicken sandwich is the best. Went here for a birthday  dinner, highly recommend

Everything we've ever had here has been amazing. comfort food with a nice twist to wholesome fresh salads with the best ingredients.  We come in every chance we get.  If you go on Sunday for breakfast the apple butter pancakes are the bomb.

Thumbs down for selection and flavor. Cost for said selection and lack of flavor makes it not worth it to me. I have never before had calamari that had no taste. My husband said is burger was decent, but for 1/3 the price we could get In n Out =/ The desserts were typical, nothing special, but at least they had flavor and were sweet enough for my hubby's sweet tooth. Service was neither excellent nor horrible. Oh, the two stars?...one is for the cute market set up at the entry.

This is hands down one of the best places I've been to eat here in Vegas. It has the romantic dining vibe with excellent food and service. Be prepared to spend a bit but it's totally worth it. A definite must go!

What a day for my phone to die.  No Yelp check-in, no pictures of my food or the space, but I do have a review!  My friend and I originally RSVP'ed for the UYE event, had to cancel, and then were able to go at the last minute on our own.  We arrived upon the restaurant opening at 11:30am and the first impression upon walking in is the refreshing, open area with clean, bright lines and a homey feeling, modern and old-school simultaneously.  The staff is mostly clad in flannel shirts and aprons, so there's a down South feel to the place that is comforting.  I went with the Grilled Barely Buzzed Cheddar Cheese sandwich served with Tuscan bean soup and my gal pal had the Biloxi Buttermilk Fried Chicken sandwich.  I have to say that, upon tasting her sandwich, I wish I had ordered it!  I'm not a fan of chicken sandwiches in general, but Honey Salt's is an exception--I'd highly recommend it!  My lunch was tasty, too, but hers was fantastic!  Service was attentive and friendly throughout the meal and I can safely say that I'll be back to have the fried chicken sandwich all to myself.  Honey Salt is a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

First time visiting! Luckily, we came in on a Monday and they offer a half price menu option. Also, the location isn't too busy when we came, which was in the mid-late afternoon. 
The venue is very American rustic, and it was super comfortable. The staff was super friendly?, too.
The food was super simple. I ordered the Margherita? Flatbread, which was a fair enough size to share with two people as a snack/appetizer? or one person can eat it as a meal (which is what I did). I was very content after my meal? but it does get soggy since it had fresh toppings.
My husband ordered Backyard Favorite Burger, which I assume was good since he didn't complain about it.
Overall, like I said, the menu is simple enough to figure out what the ingredients are since it is so fresh. In essence?, you can probably make this all at home.

Turkey meatballs... Good, fine
Brussels sprouts (yes, again)- seared, not cooked enough, fairly disappointing especially when you know the potential in those babies
Cauliflower- ok... Mine is better, there's had been held too long, but that is the way it goes when you want roasted veggies in a restaurant.
Mac and cheese- creamy and smoky, 
Apple pie- tons of butter, good flaky crust, needed more apple and a bigger scoop if ice cream (gotta have the right ratio of pie to ice cream)
Taste of salted caramel ice cream (blech.. Bit probably good if you like that sort of thing) and cake (meh).  I started with 3 stars, bit I think I am going to change to 2. Yelp, let me do 2.5 stars!!!

We drove about 45 minutes to meet friends, and it was well worth the drive to try.  We have appetizers, entree and dessert, and all were fabulous.  I also felt the service was excellent.  Atmosphere was very nice.

Bread was very authentic French.  Many people say they have this, but few really do.  

Keeping mind this is a 45 minute drive for us, would be make a special trip - no - as was not that fabulous, but if I lived within 15 minutes, we would be regulars there.  Definitely worth trying.

Laid back, homey atmosphere.  Friendly staff.  Even good kid's menu. Tempurah Eggplant (daily special) made my mouth exceedingly happy, and exceedingly sad when it was over.  Also had to restrain myself from licking the butter dish.

Gets 4 stars because the brunch menu could have a little more variety, such as options for pancakes, price is moderate an reasonable to the portions and quality of food. I had the breakfast pizza which was different at first but I liked it alot by the 2nd slice. Also had the corned beef hash that I liked alot. Definitely came at a better time then my first time. Recommend to come for brunch or dinner. If your looking for a snack the "in between" menu is good. I will be back for sure

This place is all around fantastic, beautiful set up. Great for brunch and big parties or just sitting at the bar watching the game. The bartenders are super friendly and fun to talk to. The food is delicious, the avocado toast and burger are amazing. The soap is what's up too!

File under: appetizers are better than entrees. The prosciutto flatbread and tuna poke starters were universal big hits. The main plates disappointed. A fillet ordered medium had to be sent back as it was well done, dry and inedible. The meatloaf was good but would probably benefit from a lighter vegetable pairing. The bitter Brussels sprouts were a bit overwhelming, making this a very heavy dish. Red snapper was decent but nothing special. Lastly, I asked for ice water and no ice ever materialized in my glass.

For the price, the entrees should reach a higher level. Would return though for happy hour and appetizers in a heartbeat.

This place was just so lovely! Loved the rustic vibe of the restaurant.
We came just in time for their happy hour, so of course we had to take advantage of that. We ordered almost everything on their happy hour menu except for the Margherita pizza and the elotes (only because they JUST replaced it with the eggplant dip), so I'll just go down the list on what I thought about them.
-Mac & cheese: my FAVORITE on the happy hour menu. The touch of kale and the the nutty & salty crumbs really took the dish to another level. My only problem with this dish was how long it took to cool, I kept burning my mouth it was too delicious.
-Turkey meatballs: not my favorite, the sauce tasted a bit bland
-Pork belly taco: super yummy! The sauce really makes it!
-Eggplant dip with pita: had a light flavor to it, but I loved the play on texture that they did with the dish. I think there were some nuts and something crispy in there, but overall yummy.
-Tuna Poke lettuce wrap: so yummy! Very light and simple.
-Nashville chicken bites: the components were good, but they just didn't work out for me. My least favorite from the list.

Went here on the run after my son said he wanted mac'N'cheese.  Let's just say this is the best organic farm fresh restaurant I've ever had the pleasure of dining at.  Mac was homemade with a gourmet twist!  I'm going back for B-day!
Just okay...  Was expecting a LOT better. The filet mignon was TINY and not Medium as requested. Expensive for something so tiny.

Lovely restaurant with great ambience and romantic interior. Excellent service from the servers. They have a table in front of the kitchen where a chef makes finishing touches to the food before it goes out to the customers. Their beer is awesome. Tuna salad is delicious. I will definitely go back.

Really like it here! The bread basket with the honey butter was addicting! We ordered the octopus salad and tuna poke stack, both were very tasty. I got the salmon as an entree, it was juicy and well seasoned. I also got to try the chicken breast with Mac and cheese. Everything was good, portions are kind of small for the price point. Service was great and the ambiance was casual and inviting. I would def come back and try the lunch items!

Homey and salt offers a seasonal changing farm to table menu. A true neighborhood restaurant that combines classic comfort with sophisticated atmosphere. We went there in between lunch and dinner (around 3) we we were able to order on the lunch and dinner menu (we had to wait a little bit for the dinner as they start serving at 4) everything was just supper delicious. The chocolate cake dessert is to die for! If you have not tried this restaurant yet, please do! I will be surprised if someone will give a negative review on this restaurant. For management, I would like to compliment you bartender Conner. Conner was very attentive, friendly, informative to us. He isa great assets to your company.

We had the fried mixed seafood for an app it was pretty bland and the batter was falling off and some of the clams we got were gritty. That is really the only complaint I have for the entire meal. After we had the app I had the curry Witch was delicious it came in a two layered tin with rice on top. The rice was good it had almonds in it if I remember correctly. My BF had the steak and fries it was a large portion of steak and the sauces that came with it were really tasty. I then asked the waiter if they have any nonalcoholic drinks. He took the time to ask the bartender and the bartender said he could make something up for me witch was made with apple juice mint and pear. Very good. We ended the meal with cake witch was rich and full of different layers. 
100$ for two entrees one drink one app and one dessert.

Have been here three times, I live in LA and Las Vegas. I come here especially for the food first (excellent) and second to get away from the hustle of strip. It is very loud ! Do not come on a weekend night unless you want to be rushed throughout your meal.  Very uncomfortable.  Waiter and bus boys approached us to ask us if we were finished with our plate every 3 minutes. A restaurant is were you come to enjoy the food and spend time with friends and family. At one point the manager approached us and asked if we were finished, we just had started desert ! He was pacing back and forth thru the restaurant, glancing at the tables that were not eating/leaving fast enough? He would mumble something and shake his head. This short stature man was a show by himself.  Listen I understand its a business and you need to make money... but dont do it at the expense of the patrons that are there.  Salmon was great, bathroom wallpaper is made out of sports cards? (Really). Get rid of the Tvs too, you are trying to be too many things at once.  Thanks for the memories wont be back...

This review is strictly regarding brunch - I've not ever dined at Honey Salt for dinner.

This was also my 1st time at the restaurant and I really didn't know what to expect.  I met a friend for brunch on a Sunday morning. She was seated first, since she was a bit early, and I arrived shortly after.  We we were seated on the side of the restaurant, away from the main dining room.  I found this strange, but my friend mentioned that it was very hot in the restaurant when she walked in, and the hostess recommended sitting over there because it was cooler (I didn't notice the heat).

First of all, I love the decor and vibe of this place.  It's very "shabby chic." There are lots of little knick knacks displayed throughout the restaurant and cute art on the walls.

The tables are very close to each other. Luckily, there was nobody seated next to us, so this wasn't an issue.  But I could see it being awkward if it were a busy night.

I was torn between ordering the bottomless mimosas ($20) or the "create your own" bloody marys ($22). Once I decided on the bloodys, the server actually talked me out of it - saying that they were much smaller than just ordering them individually, and I would have to do all the work (obviously). I wish I would've just ordered this, but our server convinced me that the bartender makes an awesome bloddy mary (I am very picky about them).  I ended up disappointed. There was just something "off" about the drink - it had very little flavor, and although I asked for it to be spicy and also made with horseradish, it wasn't spicy enough and I had the server bring me extra horseradish. Maybe because it was fresh horseradish? I don't know. For my 2nd drink, I ordered the blood orange mimosa, which was very good. 

For food, we started out with the monkey bread. It was a large portion, definitely enough to share ($9). We didn't come close to eating it all! I am not really a sweets person, so I only had a couple of bites.

I was set on ordering the weekend frittata, but my friend changed her mind at the last minute and also decided to order it. So I ordered the Crab Cake Benedict ($22). This was absolutely delicious! There were 2 house made crab cakes, topped with asparagus, 2 poached eggs and hollandaise.  I tasted the frittata and it was also really good! It was much larger than expected and had tons of flavor. She chose to pay $2 extra and add chicken, which I probably wouldn't have done. 

We splurged and had dessert (YOLO, right?!). We shared the Triple Strawberry Shortcake. It looked more like a large biscuit, halved and filled with strawberries and whipped cream. It also had a small scoop of strawberry ice cream on the side.  Not sure I would order it again, but as I mentioned I am not a huge sweets eater.

Our server was friendly and helpful. She had a fun, upbeat attitude which is always a plus.  Brunch was good, but there was nothing that wowed me so much that I would drive to the other side of town for.  But I am definitely glad to check another bookmark off my never ending list!

One Word = Brookie

My boyfriend and I ate here about two months ago and I cannot stop thinking about this amazing dessert. It is a combination of a brownie and a chocolate chip cookie topped with ice cream. It reminds me a Pazookie but better. MUST TRY!!
Great atmosphere. Servers were awesome! The food is unbelievable. Corned beef hash was my fav.

Food is excellent. We like to sit at the bar to eat. 
The owner is so nice! 
It's under a facelift with construction. Can't wait to see the new outside.

This is an excellent local farm to table restaurant!  Everything we have had at Honey Salt has been super fresh and delicious.  My wife often gets the Caesar Salad with salmon on top and it is always cooked beautifully.  My go-to is the Biloxi Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sandwich.  It is easily the best chicken sandwich out there!  They offer a 1/2 price menu on Monday's which is a great time to check them out!

Love the brunch and lunch.  Creative tasty dishes well-prepared and nicely presented.  Nice ambience but a little loud.  Service is good and ask about the specials.  Awesome grilled cheese and soup combo, nice salads and eclectic entrees.  Nice bar like Nora's b4 HS.

Went for my Birthday, and had brunch.  My boyfriend and I both had the Eggs Benedict with the smoked salmon.   A bit pricey for $19.00.  The eggs and english muffins were very small, and the salmon was too large for the portion.  It was a disappointment.   Flavor was nothing special.  The side dish of potatoes were greasy and overcooked.  The orange juice was the best.  The place is cute.  They obviously do not have enough staff as the wait for food was very long, and also the check.  Maybe we will give it one more shot someday, and try something else.

I really don't know what the hype is all about. The food is average, and the service was terribly..... slow. And they weren't even that busy to warrant a lack of attentiveness. I used to be in the service industry myself, and I am very understanding. No they were not busy. Our waiter probably didn't approach our table until 15 mins after we sat down. There was nothing we ate that made me feel like it was special and super delicious, except the filet. If anything I was upset with myself that I chose to try Honey Salt over our other option. My advice, their glory days have passed. Try North Italia next door. On a positive note, I guess I would say the decor was cute and the music was good.
Absolutely delicious chicken sandwich.  Gotta be one of the best ever!!  Frozen fries made it one less star.

I definitely had high expectations for this place. My hubby and I had a date night here last week for the first time. We got seated and our menu quick. Big place and nice decors. Amazing bar set up too! You can see the cooks in the kitchen cooking the meals as well. We ordered our food and ended being the only people there. Food took awhile to come out and I feel like it was a bit too long. Especially since it was just us. The server was really nice though. We ordered the margarita pizza, fried
chicken burger and the wife's favorite salad. My favorite was the fried chicken burger. Honey mustard was amazing on it!! I'd definitely go back for that again and happy hour lol. 1/3 things we liked from what we ordered. Just would have loved quicker service :)

This is a mixed review. I ordered the Cobia because I remembered catching and cooking it growing up in Florida. It was disappointing. It was overcooked and had no seasoning at all. I asked for some lime and added a lot of salt and pepper to make it and the succotash palatable. The bright spots, the bread pudding was fantastic. Our servers helper, Krystina, should be made a server. She was great and would be a terrific server.

Wonderful experience. Enjoyed our server. Food was flavorful, husband and I got bass (dry, but great flavor) friends got meatloaf and soup/salad - everyone was happy! The crowning joy for my husband was the bread pudding - "just like Earthas" (restaurant he worked in in the 90's) "I'd come back just for that!" Place settings were weird, all had dessert forks (we call them baby forks at home) except one in our party.
They did it again! Ambiance, bottomless mimosas, and the hostess Michel make honey salt such a gem! "It's a brunch thing"
This place was pretty good. Food taste fresh. It was pricy for the portion size but the taste out weighed the cost. They had a nice selection of wines. I would return for a date night with my hubby.

The decor and food are memorable: a true gem in Summerlin that usually you wouldn't expect in a city like Las Vegas. 
Unique, original, and tasty!

I ordered the Burrata and Heirloom tomatoes: yum! Just tasted like the real Italian burrata. It was followed by Mediterranean Sea Bass, cooked to perfection, with a side of Roasted Cauliflower. 

Service was excellent too.

A really good dining experience. The carmelized scallops are the best ive ever had. The sandy valley tomatoes & ahi tartare were really good as well. The brick chicken was juicy but didnt have much flavor. Overall the food was pretty good. We had Travis as a server and he was excellent! Only reason i dont give it 5 stars is it was a bit pricey for not being "fine dining". Def gonna come back for the lunch menu sometime tho.

Absolutely delicious.

   I came for lunch on a Wednesday with my wife, we have been really excited to try this new restaurant since we have heard nothing but rave reviews! Well, to our satisfaction it really lived up to all the hype!

   Now, I wasn't impressed because the complexity of the dish, rather the simple, fresh and deliciously put together ingredients. I ordered the "Crispy chicken sandwich" my wife decided to try the grilled cheese, which I can't remember the exact menu name. Both were amazing, I wouldn't hesitate to order the same exact meal again.

  Final impression? I am very excited to have such a great new restaurant in the area. I have a feeling Honey Salt is going to be around for a long time!
One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas! Best scallops...and their kale Caesar salad is delicious too!

New restaurant in Boca Park. The inside looks really nice and big so it'll be an appealing sight to the eyes.

You get complimentary bread & crackers with bean dip with your meal.

Service is mediocre but they're friendly. Friendly and nice, but their service system lacks efficiency. It took what felt like 30mins to get our check. That is REALLY lacking and annoying. 

Food is definitely 4 stars as of right now.

ORDERED:
The Mary free range chicken, aka Grain Salad. That's a 4/5 rating :o). 

This originally would've been a 4 star rating but since I wanted to leave in a timely manner and couldn't, I'm docking that extra star. I mean, we told a total of two servers that we wanted our bill and that we wanted it split. After the second server came over to confirm that, it still took him awhile until he actually got our checks. What's up with that? And it's not like they were short staffed because there were a few of them running around. The 5 of us just sat there wondering when we'll get our checks.

P.S. With your checks, you'll get a little guest book that a lot of people can sign (almost like a yearbook) and leave comments. It's a neat idea so thumbs up for that.

Last note: whie the food was decent enough for the most part, there's really nothing that stood out that will make me want to come back. :/

I've had the pleasure of dining at Honey Salt for both brunch and lunch. It has an upscale feel, while still remaining casual. It's been described as "feeling like a pottery barn." I quite like the ambiance, the mismatched furniture and chandeliers, it really takes me away from Vegas and makes me feel like I'm at a hip restaurant in a cool city. 

My husband and I first decided to check it out for lunch. He couldn't resist ordering the fried chicken sandwich and I went with the backyard burger. The fried chicken sandwich was juicy and delicious. I can see why people compare it to Chik-fil-A. The burger was seasoned perfectly, I really enjoyed the tomato jam since I'm notorious for picking my tomatoes off of my burgers. The shoe string fries were a perfect side.

More recently, my friends and I decided to check out their brunch. We started with some monkey bread for the table. It was ooey, gooey, and so delicious. It is perfect for splitting with the table and the hints of citrus really counter the sweet honey sauce. I settled on the steak and egg slider and it was a great decision. The steak was super flavorful and the entire thing just worked well together. I also felt somewhat healthy since there was creamed spinach. The breakfast potatoes were more like wedge fries, but I'm not one to complain about potatoes in any form. I also split some peach pancakes with a friend and they were delicious. There were peaches baked in, but could have used some more peaches on top. 

It wouldn't be a girls brunch without cocktails and they have a full bar. I had a delicious strawberry, prickly pear, lime, cocktail with citrus vodka. My friends all went with the bottomless mimosas, but weren't impressed with the $20 price tag. 

I will definitely be back, especially for brunch, maybe even this weekend!

It was my first time at Honey Salt. A friend of mine recommended this place and I've heard nothing but great things, so I thought I'd try it out. I already loved the ambience when I first walked into the restaurant. My friend and I sat at the bar where we were greeted by a hipster looking server named Nick. He had glasses and had a beard. He was so welcoming right off the start. We told him it was our first time at the restaurant and he kindly recommended a few things for us to try.  He recommended the grilled octopus to start off with then, Duroc pork chops, and the caramelized scallops. We got food pretty quick and I must say they were all so good!! We would definitely come back and dine here again. Customer service was on point!! Thanks to Nick for all the recommendations. Ayyyeeee! :)

I had the restaurant week menu lunch. Unfortunately, only one appetizer and one entree wasn't going to be problematic for my allergies. And, unfortunately these were items that I was not particularly interested in. But I was there already so I went with them  (props to the staff and chef for responsibly handling the matter).

The app was a Caesar salad. I don't like Caesar salads. If you do, you might enjoy it, but it is something I just can't get into. 2/5.

The entree was salmon with some seeds and grains. The presentation was nice, but the dish overall was a little underwhelming. Not bad, just not substantially impressive. I'd say 3.5/5, good enough to get again but not to seek out.

Sadly the two listed desserts didn't work with my allergy. So, the substitute was some strawberries with whipped cream. I appreciate the substitution, and it was enjoyable, but I can't say it was anything special. 3.5/5

Overall, a bit disappointing, particularly at that price point.

I went here with some friends and personally speaking I loved my meal. I got the shrimp linguine and it was delicious. However, 2 others in my group thought their meals were off. One was a grain salad and the other I can't remember. I did not taste their food so I can't speak for the details of the taste. We got the apple pie for dessert which the four of us shared. By the time the pie was served on the table we had eaten the entire thing. Big fan. Overall costs were a little high for the portions in my opinion.

Salad: 3/5 Stars
I ordered the Honey Salt Caesar salad, fresh lettuce and ingredients but the Caesar dressing was VERY salty IMO, sodium overload.

Entree: 3/5 Stars
I ordered the Filet Mignon stacked Sliders with scrambled eggs, creamed spinach, beehive cheddar. The dish only includes 2, yes TWO sliders which we're stacked pretty tall with the eggs and spinach, but very small in diameter. The steak was juicy and tender, but the flavor of sliders overall just didn't blow me away like I was expecting them to with the $18 price tag, very overpriced for what you get in my opinion. The sliders also come with a side of roasted breakfast potatoes, those were also VERY bland in my opinion. I felt like they needed some extra spice, or I was tempted to ask for....you ready for this? KETCHUP. 

Service: 5/5 Stars
Our waiter was very attentive, even with the high flow lunch crowd and never let our drinks get low.

I'm thinking I just ordered wrong, so I will return to Honey Salt and give it another try. I look forward to better experience next time around and possibly updating this entry.

Was given a great gift card for Christmas and finally made it in for a dinner date with the wife.
We were certainly pleased with the overall essence of the restaurant and full bar and how casual the employees were dressed. One thing we quickly noticed is how LOUD it was, we were in on Friday at 7pm and the place was certainly busy.

Service was certainly on point and we were greeted quickly at the table for drink order and appetizer order as well as specials. 

Overall the drinks were just great rolling with the Pomegranate Margaritas, Shirmp cocktails for apps. Then my dinner was Scottish Salmon and her's steak. Sharing was certainly great as both entrees were made with great care and tasted very nice. These items are somewhat a la carte so ordered a side of veggies. 

Also desert was great and shared and was not to disappoint.

Overall this was certainly a great dining experience and the quality of food was top notch. I did notice the menu is not large so if your looking for lots of varieties this is not that place for you but the selections they do offer are on point!

Pleased with cleanness of the restaurant and the manager stopping by to say hello and greet us. 

Will be back on for this location as to try out the bar area as it was busy the entire time I was there.

We visited Honey Salt for lunch last week. It was our first visit and was also our second pick for Restaurant Week 2015. WOW! Honey Salt did not disappoint. We stopped in for lunch last Tuesday and were immediately greet by a young hostess. We were seated, handed the lunch and special "Restaurant Week" menu and shortly there after had water on the table. We of course ordered from the Restaurant Week menu at $20.15 per person for lunch, it's a no brainer. This enabled the two of us to try six different menu options. Everything we had tasted very good and was presented beautifully.  My guy is not a big dessert person, but the Brookie, a yummy warm brownie cookie thing, with salted caramel ice cream was amazing!  He actually said "this is one of the best desserts ever!"

The d√©cor is soothing and welcoming. The staff was polite, efficient and made us feel comfortable. I highly recommend trying Honey Salt sometime soon.

For the price point, it just wasnt worth it.

Fresh food and ingredients, but TINY portions.

Meatballs were a highlight.

Honey Salt is YOUR restaurant with menu options to accommodate lifestyle dining requests, special dietary requests or food allergies. For example, the Romanesco sauce for grilled vegetables has almonds. Each dining staff member is experienced and knowledgeable; they are here to listen to your requests including nut-free, gluten-free and vegetarian and vegan.

One of my favorite places to eat at in LV.

Came here for brunch, lunch and dinner.
Love the interior & exterior of the place and love their outdoor patio that is dog friendly.

The toast with peaches are great to start with, yummy caesar salad and burger. I wasn't take huge on the fried chicken sandwich but I'm still giving this place a 5 star.

I will def come back and try other things on the menu.
Great service, never a problem with parking or getting seated right away.
Love the vibe and the food here! Have even used DoorDash to get their chicken dinner with the awesome mac and cheese at home. Worth it!!!

Love this hidden gem! Amazing service from our server Paul and the staff! The food was delicious and perfect in every aspect; quality, size, taste and price. Warm atmosphere! We shall be back for more!

Came here on a week night. Staff was friendly happily recommended the sea bass and I decided on the turkey meatball pizza. The bass came out beautifully with a crispy skin and was tasty. The meatball pizza was just ok. Flavor of the sauce was ok and lacked seasoning. the meatballs were delicate but nothing spectacular. The restaurant itself was different but I felt like Pottery Barn exploded all over the entire restaurant, but the style fell a little flat . The kitchen was an open air concept which is cool I guess but I really don't care who's cooking my food as long as it's done safely with quality products. Not sure if I'll be back
The food was delicious! The staff was amazing! We went here to wrap up our Las Vegas trip and was very satisfied with the experience.

Place was amazing!! Food was really good! I had the PB & J French toast, checked sausage, scrambled eggs with cheese and potato fries!! All was amazing!! Ate it all and it wasn't heaven at all. Place looks great! It was my first time there. My mom had the quinoa salad with chicken! She loved it I had a taste it was great chicken was cooked to perfection. Just a heads up happy hour is 3 PM to 6 PM! Enjoy!

Great atmosphere with a friendly and knowledgeable wait staff. Started off with happy hour drinks and appetizers which were all great. Then we got the entrees which looked amazing but unfortunately the strip steak  fell flat. I ordered it medium rare but when it came out it was over cooked, tough and dry. The  chimichurri sauce that was drizzled on the plate was super tasty but there wasn't enough of it to drown the steak in. If you go in be sure to get the mac and cheese side. One of the best macs I've had.

Amazing lunch outside! The salty spicy chips with sweet honey butter was amazing! Service excellent. The server even helped my vegan gluten free wife come up with something to eat! Excellent and can't wait to try something new next time!

This place gets a solid three for decoration and that's it.  The food is extremely mediocre for the price point.

To begin- they need to take the curry off the menu ASAP.  What a horrible dish!!!!  I'm a bit at fault for ordering curry in a place like this, but I didn't think that they'd butcher it the way they did.  This dish was inedible.  It didn't taste like anything.  The only flavor profile I got was spicy, it didn't even taste like curry.  It was watered down spice- haha- really though. Gosh.  Disgusting.  Served with a bland mango/pear chutney, dry basmati rice, and a basic ass yogurt sauce that had no taste.

Pork chop was salty, octopus had  components that worked together, but was salty as hell.  Pizza dough on the appetizer was good, but the ingredients it was topped with were nothing special.  Last, the brookie (cookie/brownie) was hard.  The only part that was moist was right under the salted caramel ice cream.  Cookie was inedible cause it was rock solid.

Our server was really basic too.  He didn't seem very genuine, didn't make me feel like I just had a great experience.  He was just going through the motions of being a "server". 

I've been here twice now.  One for lunch, and now dinner; I will not be coming back. 

I'm not going to lie, but the thirty minutes it took me to get here, only to throw away $22 on an entree I took one bite of, def added to the salty experience.  Waste of gas, waste of $$$, waste of time.

Second time here. This time for brunch. The service was ok. We waited a while even when we were seated. Only 5 of us. The air con was not working correctly so nothing like eating while sweating. We had to wipe the baby down with a cold wet towel to keep him happy. 
I had the chicken sandwich   Elevated it with an egg and bacon. Only way to fly.  The flavors were ok.  The monkey bread was basic. The overwhelming Feeling at the table was that it needed more caramel sauce. We ordered two and both were lackluster.  
The place was busy for a Sunday brunch. Just so many other option out there if this is the service and quality.  Flavors were eh.
BEST BRUNCH IN TOWN!! Dominique & Waldo KILLED it this week. Love love love this place.

My open table points could not be noted because I arrived less than five minutes late. Dinner was great, but absolutely no parking at 7:00 pm on Saturday night. We got there 15 minutes early, and we have to fight traffic in the parking lot to find a spot. I would not go again to any of the restaurants there again as there is no parking. I highly recommend Downtown Summerlin as an alternative. At least Blau's Andiron has parking.

We were staying at the Red Rock and cruising around on a lazy Sunday to find a brunch spot.  Turned to Yelp and picked Honey Salt.  The restaurant is tucked away in the corner of a little strip mall and it was not visible from the street.

At first glance, the menu is very promising.  Starting with the bread service, the crispy flatbread and butter is a nice little twist.  Next up, My Wife's Favorite Salad with duck confit.  It was as good as advertised.  This was probably the best dish of the meal.  I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and I had high hopes.  Unfortunately, the chicken was very dry.  It could have used a lot more of the durkee dressing.  Also, the slaw was a bit bland for me.  I thought the sandwich itself could have benefited from some form of acid to brighten it up.  My wife ordered the farmer's toast with persimmon.  It was ok, but overall too sweet with the persimmon, honey and wheat bread.  My kiddo was happy with her mac and cheese and DIY sundae.

Service was subpar in my opinion.  This was surprising as we were one of the first ones in the restaurant and there were only a handful of tables occupied with an equal amount of servers.

I want to like this place so much more as it seems to a lot of promise.  The sad truth is that I may never try it again as we normally stay on the strip and the Red Rock stay was a one time deal.
Every time we come back something always changes... Love the ambiance but the food and service keeps changing for the worse. Hate it when good places go down;(

Nice place.  Nice decor.  Nice place to bring a date just cause it consists a lot of details that females find pretty "creatively tantalizing" (per my fianc√©).  

But if you have a hearty-sized-stomach and cares more about your appetite rather than how your plate looks -- well there's a Cheese Cake factory that serves larger sized portions and offers just about the same quality taste, just across the street (just sayin').

- New England Fry (too greasy and they only gave us 3 shishito peppers which was the best part of the app). 
- Burrata & Heirloom Tomatoes "Kim's style" (kudos on the combination of chocolate and homemade mozzarella cheese, but the portion was way too small even though the server said it would feed 2 people).
- Grilled Scottish Salmon (It was OK.  Just ok.  Nothing to write about.  Seriously.)
- Chocolate Buttermilk Crunch Cake (served as layered cake.  Very sweet.  Nice dessert.)

Overall, if you're looking at going to a nice romantic place, I suggest going to an upper scale steakhouse or French restaurant.  Just cause you'll end up spending the same amount of money for a lot more food and ambiance.  

Cheers!

First time here today and I will be back. The food was amazing, great service and wonderful location. Love the decor and they have a great selection of food. I love the variety that they have. This is my new favorite spot.

Was here with a group of nine. Food was great! Service was great! I had the chicken sandwich which is "fried" on the menu but they easily accommodated my request for grilled chicken. The sandwich was a bit messy but worth it. The brioche bun held up very well against the coleslaw and sauce. 
Changed the side salad to fries and the cane with homemade ketchup! Yum!

Everyone was mostly happy with their meals. One ordered eggs bennidict and did the sauce did not taste good.

Try this restaurant!

Very impressed with this establishment. The way they run their operation is awesome. Great service all around, ambiance is very chill + smooth (some good music playing in the background), the main course was cooked perfectly. Midnight Rambler is my favorite drink now. So, I can't complain. ..well... Maybe just one, the New England Fry wasn't cooked well bc the batter wasn't fully cooked. 

But man.... The chicken and pork chop was damn good! Seriously. The chicken was juicy and they left the skin nice and crunchy! My friend gave me a piece of the pork chop and that too was cooked perfectly! Wish we had this place in Los Angeles. 

Anyways, I've had like 4 of the "midnight rambler" (their signature cocktail- damn good) and I'm just rambling on so I'll end this review here and maybe edit this when I'm in a sober state of mind. Peace!

Went to honeysalt for brunch today and it was amazing! I had the chicken sandwich and it blew me away, I'm not a big chicken sandwich person but it was really delicious. The service was great, and the restaurant has an amazing vibe.
Great delicious food! Had the breakfast pizza as a appetizer and a medium cook burger with fried egg on top which was very juicey.

I have been to dinner several times and decided to try brunch. The place was packed! We had the crab cups as an appetizer, they were amazing! The Benedict was awesome; however, the frittata was dry and overlooked as was the chicken that was added. The bread pudding was the best part of the meal and a must try. 
My only disappointment was the service. I wouldn't order bottomless drinks, as we had to flag down our server to ask for a refill and the server wasn't very attentive, hence the 3 star.
I feel inspired to get a crystal chandelier. I went straight for the overindulgence of comfort food.  I loved the decor.

I'd like to say we had a great time for drinks at Honey salt, but we did not. It was a typical busy Sunday afternoon. We wanted bottomless mimosas but they said they only had two bottles left so it wasn't worth getting. (I'm sorry, how do you offer bottomless mimosas and then don't have enough champagne to supply for a typical Sunday brunch that's available till 4 pm?! Like do you not want our money?). The staff at the bar was inattentive and was eating behind the counter where they were serving the drinks to the rest of the restaurant (so gross). Makes me wonder if they actually washed their hands or just licked off the food before touching my glass and wiping down the "clean" dishes. I asked for a menu, bar tender clearly forgot. Then had to ask me what I asked them for....  it took them 10 minutes to find a menu. The other person behind the bar clearly was new and had no idea what was on the menu. The only time we actually got attention near us was when someone that the bartenders knew. We wanted more drinks but decided that our money was best spent elsewhere.

TL;DR This place is well worth visiting if you are in Las Vegas. Lots of complaints about the table near the bathroom so if you can, ask for a table elsewhere. Sea scallop and free range chicken are bomb. I would recommend and come back to this place when in Las Vegas. 

This place did not disappoint. I was surprised that the place was not packed with the food was above average. This review has been sitting in my drafts for awhile now. I have been to tons of places in LV that are packed, but the food taste like garbage diving soup. Enough with my bad experiences in LV, lets talk Honey Salt.

The ambiance was great. It had a rustic, hipster feel to it. Love the decor overall and the mirrors were unique. You can feel the character the mirrors had on the wall. Every place has to have it's own style, and I feel like the mirrors were it. It is all the small details that matter the most and this place has it. The bathroom was decorated nicely and was very cool. I feel like you wouldn't like it if you don't like places with personality. The salt scrub was a very nice touch and goes that extra mile you never expected. 

I have been told constantly that restaurants serve stale bread to enhance the taste of the food coming out. Honestly it just ruins my appetite. Usually shitty bread comes with shitty food. Instead of bread, we got chips and boy were they fresh. Still hot out of the oven, crispy, and flaky. With their homemade honey butter, OMG it is almost to die for. The butter was amazing. With a starter like that, I couldn't wait to get my food. Just writing this review is making me drool. 

Calamari was great. Probably one of the best places in Las Vegas to get calamari. My review probably will do no justice for it so you should just try it yourself. I think it might be the bread they use, but it just has that crisp you rarely find even at fancy restaurants. Crisp is key.

I think the best test of a restaurant are their scallops. The sea scallops here were great. I am tired of going to places where the scallops is never fresh (in California. We live next to the ocean FFS). The sauce is superb. The scallops alone are only half the battle, everything else depends on the sauce and it was spot on for me.The subtle vanilla fragrance enhanced my dining experience for sure. I wish it was a little more caramelized, but to all their own. 

I only tried some, but the other main dish that was amazing was the free range chicken. It was absolutely succulent. In combination with the crispy skin it was a great compliment of flavors with a contrast of textures in my mouth. Honestly the chicken alone does no justice so be sure to portion out the skin with the chicken. Some people like crunchy chicken, but I like my skin crisp and boy was it crisp. It's not soul food, but it was some good chicken.

Anyways this review is getting pretty long so I will just end it here. Try it out.

Still great..... It's earned another star on business lunches since the first. :)
Had tomato soup on a rainy day. There's nothing you wouldn't love.

The Mac n cheese (minus the bread crumbs) and the salted caramel crunch ice cream were absolutely delightful!! I adored each bite which I ate very slowly!  The service was spectacular.

The filet was enjoyable as was the pear salad.  I would eat both again.

I'm not a huge fan of octopus but there's was alright.  The shrimp appetizer was a bit fishy and not really to my liking.

They do offer acqua panna bottled water which I always appreciate.

The atmosphere is very Summerlin'ish.  It's an older crowd and they are all dressed up for dinner.
Best dinner I've had in a long time! Great atmosphere and we had a very friendly waitress. The scallops were amazing!
Staff was amazing, food was exquisite, and I had to have to peach cobbler. It's in season and I can't miss my opportunity  Great environment for just about any occasion!

This place is cute and sweet.  Love the d√©cor. 

Environment - 5
Clean, organized, nicely decorated 
Service - 5
Angel was great.  Very attentive.  
Fast service
Food - 5
Very good.  Plus half price with a lot of dishes! Can't beat that
Overall - 5
Very enjoyable afternoon meal

Highly recommend. Located in a super nice plaza and area.  

Loved it.

Consider visiting this restaurant your ticket to a dinner theater show called "Summerlim  Moms".  In this no-holds barred domestic cavalcade, the topics range from the latest refurbished cuisinart deals to the fact that the Vitamix can indeed make soup!  They should make the food optional and charge admission.

The food actually isn't bad, although it's not inventive by any means, but that isn't the main attraction anyway, right?

Review is for Dinner, Friday night, 3/29. Great food, but LOUD, LOUD, LOUD. Concrete floor, wood tables, stone wall. Near the kitchen, forget about holding a conversation. Great steak and tuna tartar appetizers. Loose the kale in the caesar. Turkey meatballs, meh. Excellent tomato salad with dark chocolate, go figure! Either steak was superb, rare. Excellent fish special. Great creamed spinach with onion drizzle rings. How about just a plate of the onion drizzle rings appetizer please! Bag apple pie is nothing special. Great chocolate cake, add some carmel IC. Weak, overpriced wine list. Did I mention it was loud?

My mom came to town last week and I had been hearing about this restaurant. My husband and I took her. 

I had the scallops - so insanely good! My husband had the shrimp linguine and he keeps talking about how good it was! My mom had the roasted chicken and talked about it the remainder of her trip.

Portion size is perfect! I didn't have that "I just gorged myself" feeling. I will absolutely come again!

Great spot for date night or girls night out!

I've become pretty dependent on Yelp  when we eat out . I pick the restaurant and food items from the reviews here. Been here two times and both times the food is average overpriced for what it is. For example their famous burger with egg on top. It's just a burger unless u add the egg for an extra charge .I ve made better burgers at home with an egg on top 
Yelp let me down on this restaurant . I don't get the high reviews.
Service and ambience is good

My daughter-in-law found this place looking for farm to table restaurant and found this. Not only is the decor perfect the service was wonderful. There were six of us and everyone loved their food. I had the seared ahi salad and I loved it. If I ever go back to Las Vegas I will definitely come back here. It was by far my favorite meal.

One of the best neighborhood gems in Las Vegas.  A foodie heaven for sure, with fresh farm-to-table fare!  If you are staying on the strip it is well worth the drive to Summerlin (my old stomping grounds) for an exceptional dinner.  

Note that the dishes are seasonal so you may not see the dishes I talk about below on the menu.

The fried chicken was out of this world.  I have had many upscale, foodie fried chicken dishes and this was 2 out of 3 (Stripsteak still tops the list).  Juicy, crispy, perfectly cooked and bursting with flavor.  Also the scallops with parsnip puree and cauliflower was to-die-for.  I wanted to literally pick up my dish and lick it clean.  

They also have a great selection of specialty cocktails and wine.  They also homemade non-alcoholic beverages, which is a huge plus in my book.  More restaurants should have these options - helps the restaurant and provides non-alcoholic options besides tea and soft drinks.

Only negative is that in the winter, the restarant can get very cold and drafty with the location of the front door.  

When I am back in Vegas, Honey Salt will be at the top of my list!

I really enjoy coming here. The atmosphere is great for groups or parties. They've even got a separate room for private dining. 

The only thing I'd suggest is that they offer an exclusive vegetarian/vegan menu or just had more of those options overall.

Went for Yelp Shares the Love! I sat at the bar. 
The bartender didn't know about it. The offer was for any dessert or sangria. They have red and white sangria, and I chose red. It was very tasty, and they have the sangria in large glass containers right at the bar. The space is very open and nicely appointed, with a subtle homey vibe. The dining room was pretty busy, and since I'm more of a fan of eating at the bar, I stayed at the bar. They have outdoor seating, and if I return to try some food, that would be a viable option for sure.

Great brunch place to do with friends. I'm a fan of the PB and J French toast. I liked it a little better than the ricotta pancakes, but it's all good. All of the meals have you feeling light afterwards and not bloated.

I came here for lunch after a hike, so we were absolutely starving. Walking into the restaurant, the decor is super cute. I loved the fresh plants sitting in the front and the smaller details, like the monogrammed napkins. The menu is relatively small, but after ordering a number of things, I can attest that this place values quality over quantity.

Calamari: 5/5
Its super crispy and cooked to perfection so it wasn't chewy at all. There was a perfect amount of breading, the sauce it came with complemented the calamari incredibly well, and it came with fried lemons that were surprisingly delicious.

Margherita pizza: 5/5
I loved it! The crust was so fluffy, and the sauce was made with heirloom tomatoes so it was flavorful and sweet.

Mac n' cheese: 5/5
Mac n' cheese is the holy grail of this place. This is hands down the best macaroni and cheese I have ever had. Most places add truffle oil and breading and it's good. But this place is on a whole other level. They also add kale, so maybe you won't feel so guilty for all of that yummy, gooey cheese. 

Tuna poke lettuce cup: 3/5
Not a fan. The fish was good and fresh. I thought the flavor was subtle, and it kind of lacked texture.

Overall: 5/5
Love this place!! My only regret is that I haven't been here again.

Food was good, I was put off by the seats and the table. The table was unbalanced and I felt that my drink my slide away from me. Staff was friendly and they suggested the sea bass. It was tasty and I did enjoy it. Food was what I would expect for the price. 

Some issues that I had, the place was kinda dark. The noise level was extreme and my wife had to sit next to me to hear me. 

For the most part I was happy with this restaurant however I won't be going back.

Have been wanting to try Honey Salt for a while now and Restaurant Week was a perfect reason to stop in for lunch. We arrived just before noon and it was packed. We were lucky to get one of the last tables. I absolutely loved the decor here. The white brick, wood floors, wood tables, it all works perfectly. Our server took quite a while to come over to our table but once she did she was super friendly. 

Honey Salt was offering a three course lunch for $20 for RW. I chose the Elizabeth Caesar, the buttermilk fired chicken sandwich and the brookie. My other half chose the turkey meatballs, backyard burger and the brookie. 

The salad was quite small but packed with flavor. I didn't try the meatballs but was told they were okay, just a little dry. The chicken sandwich and burger were very big. My chicken sandwich had two large pieces of fried chicken. I thought it was good but not great. The coating was quite soft instead of crispy. My other half loved his burger.
